description: 该职位来源于猎聘  工作职责:  1、负责区域内中小客户销售策略制定及执行，通过电话或社交工具等方式完成所负责区域内销售计划；  2、主要通过电话的方式，负责所辖区域市场的开发、维护、运营、管理，促进公司业务可持续发展；  3、开拓新客户资源，同时维护老客户的购买需求；  4、收集、汇总、挖掘客户对于产品的潜在需求，负责销售区域数据及客户信息的收集、整理、分析；  5、与外部销售一起，根据公司经营目标制定销售计划方案（包括客户覆盖计划、销售跟进计划等），完成销售任务。  任职资格:  1、工作经验：2年以上电话销售工作经验，；  2、具备通过电话挖掘需求，开发商机的能力；  3、拥有客户财务部或人力资源部联络资源者优先；  4、具备RPA+AI、AI相关的软件订阅销售经验者优先；  知识/技能：  （1）具备快速学习新新产品解决方案能力；善于捕捉客户思想，快速匹配客户业务需求及产品优势，并根据这些信息提出新产品和服务的建议书，提出新颖、高效的销售手段；  （2）对不同行业客户的财务、人力资源、客服、呼叫中心业务及流程有一定的了解；  （3）强烈的竞争意识、开拓意识和创新意识，执行能力强；  （4）能承受压力、对自我有更高目标设定、擅长内外部沟通；  公司亮点：  1、公司属于高新技术企业；  2、RPA属于AI行业细分领域，行业发展前景好，职位发展空间大；  3、大牛多，学习氛围浓厚。  薪资可谈

description: Company Description  At Infobip we dream big. Last year, over half of the world’s population interacted with businesses through the Infobip platform. It didn’t happen by chance: through 50+ offices on 6 continents, we are truly committed to helping our 200 000 enterprise clients reach and engage mobile users. Join us in driving the continuous success of Infobip by creating products that our customers love.  Job Description  Why is this role important at Infobip?  As Sales Development Representative you will have the opportunity to be our first impression on all prospective clients in the APAC market. Our vision of greatness in a Sales Development Representative is a brand ambassador that opens doors to all of our target clients, meaningfully filling the top of the Sales funnel, with a competitive drive to succeed.  You know you are doing a good job when you are: Reach out leads and follow up as required Managing Outbound leads, setting up meetings with Account Executives (A and B). Work closely with Enterprise Sales team, defining the best strategy to approach new leads and focus on target verticals. Provide ongoing feedback to the sales and marketing department for continuous process optimization. Use and maintain the Salesforce for data quality. Achieve defined KPI goals. Accept feedback and training to keep continuous development with Inside Sales Team Leader and peers. Identify customer segment and vertical and/or need early in discussion in order to route properly to the Sales Enterprise Team in the region. Support Sales Team with outbound prospect accounts into the A/B segment. Qualifications  More about you: Experience with lead development from first contact of target customers. Minimum 1 year of experience in sales roles. Good sales-oriented communication skills. Robust negotiation skills. Passionate about creating meaningful connections. Creative problem solver with a proven ability to think strategically. Strong administrative and organizational skills, with a focus on metrics supported results. Additional Information  Why our employees choose us (and stay)? Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Learn as you grow – Starting from the Orientation Week as an onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Connect globally – Work with people from different countries, participate in the biggest IT and Telecom events, join us in our Summer Connect conference in Croatia. We put the “global” in globalisation. Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, travel allowances, expatriate compensation packages for your business trips, rewards and holiday bonuses, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team buildings and other organised activities, company library, organised sports, kitchen stocked with the usual suspects… Talk about a balanced lifestyle! By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Today Lonza is a global partner in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.  We are currently looking for Sales Manager in Lonza Bioscience. You will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.  Key Responsibilities  To achieve sales targets by increasing product sales to existing and potential Pharma and Biotech (and academic) customers.  Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform  Develop tactical action account plans to increase sales to reach budgeted sales objectives  Assess sales potential in order to achieve specific sales targets  should Provide financial information to management by researching and analyzing accounting data; preparing reports. Prepares asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information  Maintain accurate customer data in CRM  Follow up on leads and opportunities on a timely fashion manner  Prepare and submit to management timely and accurate reports that provide information regarding sales and market activity and current status of major accounts  Accurately report financial forecast information for the designated territory on a regular and annual basis  Key Requirements  Rich sales working experience in biopharma, vaccine, cell and gene therapy field. Articulate and well accustomed to a client facing role  Education: Bachelor degree above, major in bioscience related.  Good team player, result-oriented, open mind, and love to face challenge.  Good English in written and oral will be plus  Business travel: 50%  Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.  People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: ITRENEW  ITRenew is a multinational corporation creating circularity models and second lives for some of the most advanced data center technology on the planet. With sustainable products and services that power cloud and enterprise data centers, edge infrastructure, AI/ML, embedded and industrial systems worldwide, ITRenew is opening up billions in new financial opportunity across the ecosystem, slashing time-to-value, e-waste and CO2, and making hyperscale hardware accessible and affordable for all. It’s why data center owners, service providers and enterprises worldwide choose ITRenew to design, build, sustainably scale and securely decommission their critical infrastructure.  THE OPPORTUNITY  ITRenew is in the midst of transformative growth. Between core business expansion, new acquisitions, and the development of completely new business lines, the firm is on a trajectory that will make ITRenew a $1BN business within 3-4 years. The Sales role in Asia Pacific Region is an integral role for re-marketing Data Center gear in the largest market for secondary IT hardware in the world.  Responsibilities Maintain existing accounts and develop new accounts throughout Asia for IT Data center servers and commodities. Collaborate with US based Sales leadership and sales force on an ongoing basis. Manage on-site client service needs and relationships as needed. Develop, maintain and execute a territory plan Maintain sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitor information. Contribute to team effort by accomplishing personal goals Meet with customers to discuss their evolving needs and to assess the quality of our company's relationship with them Develop and implement new sales initiatives, strategies and programs to capture key demographics Qualifications Understanding of Secondary market in China, Japan, Singapore and Korea. Must be fluent in Mandarin and English 3+ years selling IT assets in the secondary market. Must have deep knowledge of enterprise server hardware and components. Experience at a reseller or IT Asset Disposition company is preferred. Expertise in systems including Microsoft Office products High-energy, self-starter who thrives in fast-paced entrepreneurial and collaborative environments. Proven track record of innovative strategic thinking balanced with a strong customer and quality focus Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross functional teams including sales, finance, compliance, logistics, and data center management Sophisticated research, data gathering, analysis, and synthesis skills Ability to seamlessly juggle diverse projects simultaneously Living and working from Asia is preferred
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Company Description  The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 402,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2017). The company generated sales of 78.1 billion euros in 2017. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing. It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life.”  Job Description Develop and acquire new business opportunities and new projects. Analyse the competition situation and define the battle plan and winning strategy. Establish good relationship and communication channel with customers, quickly and smoothly solve the customer complaints, handle the customer special requirements, and enhance the customer satisfactory. Take leading position in negotiation regarding all commercial related with customers. Drive the internal processes for new acquisitions including project calculation, cost targeting and so on. Manage accurate monthly forecast and planning. Follow up account payment and receivable. Coordinate the sales team for general task e.g. data collection, delegation. Some other additional task Qualifications Bachelor degree or above 5 years continuous sales experience in automotive industry Good communication and coordination ability Basic technical knowledge of related products and automotive technology Relevant customer experience preferred Willing to travel and take additional task assigned by manager. Good presentation skill is necessary Fluent English in written and spoken
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Computer Software, and Automotive

description: We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.  Under direct supervision, a Technical Sales Consultant I provides technical support to sales representatives in a geographic area to assist sales efforts. He/she is responsible for providing thought leadership as it pertains to the technical aspects of proposed software/services solutions for each individual customer. Analyze the customer environment, discover and diagnose a system or business problem. Create and conduct product & solution presentations to customers. Work with the customer and internal teams to create detailed workflow solutions. Provide solution recommendations to customers via white board presentations, conference calls, live product demonstrations and webinars. Develop relationships with customers and vendors to better understand customer needs and expand the reach of possible solutions. Functions as a liaison between the customer and the product development team to help drive product innovation and quality. Job role contributes directly to value creation via personal contributions. Skills typically acquired through completion of an undergraduate degree in engineering, geoscience, computer science or similar discipline. This position is considered entry technical sales in the application of product, equipment and solutions for an assigned PSL. Skills are typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in a related Science discipline (discipline may vary by domain) and a minimum 1-3 years of progressive experience in the energy software industry. description: 该职位来源于猎聘  The Market Sales Representative - Food Analysis Solutions – (FAS) is responsible for lead execution of the FAS Market Sales strategy in China (The Territory), with the key objective to deliver on defined sales targets (Quarterly) and to drive growth in the FAS Market. They are accountable for defining a Business/Sales Plan to successfully grow BBIO business in stated markets and achieve the business goals defined as per the BBIO strategic Business Plan (5Y).  They will work in close collaboration with the Market Representative FAS, as well as with the Regional Sales group, to define and execute customized Go to Market approaches and to support Key Account sales strategy in the FAS Market, thus enabling BBIO to leverage its full existing Solution Portfolio across customers value chains.  They will deliver the annual and quarterly growth in NOBs and revenue, in a profitable way, and in accordance with BBIO’s annual and quarterly financial objective for the FAS Market in The Territory.  They are responsible for the sales of BBIO total solutions in the FAS market, and potentially specific selected Key Accounts (either in a Global KA sales role or in a regional support capacity). This role will generate sustainable growth by broadening value, with existing and novel solutions (for the customer end-to-end value chain), while strengthening the business and partnerships with established customers.  They have advanced specialized knowledge and understanding of the FAS market and should become a trusted partner for our customers in that segment. They will also develop our business by pro-actively targeting new customers in full alignment within the Commercial Organization.  职责描述： Grow BBIO‘s sales through New Order Booking and Revenue Recognition in The Territory (FAS Markets) by leveraging the full BBIO portfolio relevant to Food Analysis Solution customers. Through building sustainable business partnerships with major corporations in all FAS Subsegments, position BBIO as an End-to-End partner for the complete value chain in the segment and an endorsed supplier in the FAS marketplace. Sell BBIO’s complete solution portfolio, ranging from Food Screeners, software, and services, to Benchtop based Application solutions in all subsegments of the FAS market. Identify a balanced mix of target customers, qualify & maximize BBIO’s business potential for “Designed-In” solutions, and establish sustainable business co-operations with their Decision & Buyer Center in order to deliver business performance (NOB, Revenue, GM) according to the annual and quarterly plan. Act as Key Account Sales Manager for specific FAS Accounts in The Territory that have been assigned. Drive all necessary communication, demo activity, legal requirements, quoting and follow up activities required to close sales in designated opportunities. Focus on penetration strategies for assigned qualified Key Accounts with the goal to achieve “Design-In” projects when possible. For assigned qualified Key Accounts, maintain strong account knowledge and management, ensure that all required resources are utilized in an effective and timely manner to meet the defined customer issue resolution needs (SLS, Back Office) where required. Protect and enhance BBIO’s customer facing reputation. Lead regular interdisciplinary key account task force meetings to resolve pending topics quickly and efficiently. Work in accordance with Miller Heiman Strategic and Key Account Selling Methodologies. Accountable for business results, including annual and quarterly NOB and revenue/market share targets in the FAS Market in The Territory. Own, measure and report sales progress and accurate forecasting within a timely manner through a set of relevant KPI’s within CRM (Salesforce.com). Responsible for implementing the BBIO sales expansion strategies for FAS markets in The Territory. Closely work with Market Manager - FAS and BBIO Marcom to create and execute impactful market lead generation and awareness campaigns in stated region, with the aim of maximising sales growth. Attend specialized events to promote BBIO’s solutions, and assist with the proactive follow up of leads generated Closely work with local Field Application Experts to minimize Sales cycle and time to money for opportunities (time to convert Lead2NOB). Keep abreast of key priorities and changes in FAS Market trends, including changes in regulatory requirements which may pertain to the business, and providing feedback to Global Sales Director - Market Sales – FAS and Market Management, as well as R&D team on a regular basis  任职要求： High level of autonomy, Self-disciplined and reliable, strong time management skills Strong sales-oriented attitude combined with Performance culture High productivity, high quality work Strong drive and enthusiasm combined with can-do attitude Excellent interpersonal skills and teamwork spirit Ability to adapt to change rapidly if needed Strong analytical and organizational skills Problem-solving positive attitude Accessible and open personality Excellent communication (both written and oral) skills Impeccable personal presentation A proven team player with a strong work ethic who will enhance the performance of the BBIO Market Sales team and will complement the capabilities already in place. Must have the ability to react quickly to market requirements with excellent account evaluation and qualification skills. A driven and highly motivated, self-starting sales professional with successful track record in selling high value capital equipment 5+ years’ work experience including minimum 3 years’ sales experience driving and managing a portfolio of technical life science FAS product sales with associated market knowledge of FAS markets Able to demonstrate proven, successful sales experience in increasingly responsible roles across multiple vertical and market segments Successful track record of key account sales management and business growth in FAS/ Academia or an adjacent industry sector. Strong experience of usage and understanding of Complex & Strategic Selling strategies for business development and account share growth. Expertise in value chain management with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities required to diagnosis customer needs and propose technical solutions that address business requirements. Previous exposure to NMR / associated analytical technologies is required. Deep understanding of FAS customer value chains. Has expertise with Value Chain Management and the provision of technical solutions to address a business requirement within in the value chain. Possess and further develop strong network of contacts in stated Market segments Demonstrated experience with cost analysis and justifications required and the ability to present developed business case analysis to executive management. Can demonstrate and convey theoretical and practical understanding of NMR/TD/EPR technology as well as competing analytical tools (MS, IR) Good level of English verbal, written, computer, technical, and proposal communication and presentation skills, including proficiency with MS Office Suite - inc MS Teams Experience daily use and maintenance of Salesforce.com / SAP or similar CRM tool

Measuring and assessing performance including developing and implementing metrics and operating reporting 13.Results Oriented - Energetic, resourceful, with strong service orientation and positive can-do attitude. Fully committed to the job and to deliver outstanding work. Never satisfied with status-quo, continually striving for excellence.

description: Job Description  Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds  Position Title: Channel Development, Analyst/ Associate  Location: Shanghai, China  Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 747 offices in 42 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values based on integrity, excellence and giving back. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  Morgan Stanley Huaxin Fund Management Co., Ltd. (“Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds”) has changed registration with the Industry and Commerce Bureau on June 12, 2008 and is now Sino-foreign joint venture funds management company (formerly known as Jutian Fund Management Company established in 2003) with registered capital of RMB 227.5 million. Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds is headquartered in Shenzhen, and has two branches, one in Beijing and the other in Shanghai.  “Gather World Wise, Achieve Ideal Life”. As a joint venture fund management company, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds benefits from the global vision of its foreign shareholder, Morgan Stanley, and absorbs the local investment wisdom from its Chinese major shareholder, Huaxin Securities. Supported by both foreign and domestic shareholders, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds has devoted itself to becoming a leading asset management company in China. Established in Chinese market and benefiting from its international background, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds commits itself to building a harmonious, normative, transparent and progressive corporate culture and providing fund investors with good investment returns and professional services.  Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds provides diversified and professional investment management services to fund investors, including actively managed products, indexing investment products, quantitative investment products, fixed income products and separately-managed account (SMA) products, with a goal to meet investors’ needs for asset allocations, risk management and producing investment returns.  Responsibilities Responsible for business development and sales channel maintenance with Financial Institutions (both Banking and NBFI channels) in East China region; Work closely with relevant parties in product development, launch, and promotion; Act as the contact point for clients, and service regional clients’ needs; Customize investment products and provide investment advice to client’s; Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above from top universities. Master’s degree in a Business related subject is preferable; Sound knowledge in the fund industry in general, and conversant in the firm’s product offerings; At least 2-3 years’ sales experience in to Financial Institutions (both Banking and NBFI), preferably with major domestic banks; Good communication and interpersonal skills, and a strong sense of customer service Able to travel for work;

description: Job Summary Job Summary  As a Tory Burch Sales Associate you are responsible for delivering a transformational customer experience, building our brand one customer at a time and ultimately driving our business through sales. You should demonstrate a strong commitment to service, a genuine curiosity and interest in people, authenticity, fashion & style sensibility, and exceptional selling skills. The ideal candidate also understands how to be a team player, is savvy about the visual and operational aspects of the role, and is committed to loss prevention.  Responsibilities  JOB DESCRIPTION  Drive the Business & Deliver Results Achievement of personal sales and metric goals. Build and maintain new and existing customer relationships. Maintain a solid, organized client book which furthers your customer relationships and generates consistent, proactive sales volume, following the standards of our clienteling philosophy. Be aware of and react to the rhythm of your business, not just relying on walk-in traffic but through clienteling, outreach and event opportunities. Be Buddy/Team Player Lead by example and model behavior that reflects the company’s core values. Appropriately manage conflict and take ownership for your part in the team dynamic. Demonstrate a high degree of maturity and integrity. Contribute to a positive atmosphere that is fun, professional, productive and team oriented. Create The Customer Experience Contribute to an environment that consistently delivers on the five stages of the transformational customer experience. Demonstrate strong use of selling skills. Ensure a high level of customer service through extensive product knowledge and product ownership. Take ownership for the transformational experience in your boutique – customize it for your customer demographic and develop & maintain productive customer relationships. Maintain a “One Company” perspective on charge sends, returns, and other such transactions that are critical to a positive customer experience. Have a thorough understanding and use of the technology tools that support the customer experience Represent the Brand Understand and communicate the Tory Burch brand philosophy and lifestyle with each other and the customer. Emulate the brand aesthetic and embody a strong sense of fashion and an enthusiastic attitude. Contribute to maintaining all brand and operating standards to support brand consistency. Assist in maintaining store presentation standards. Leverage in-store technology to ensure every customer’s experience is transformational. Operational Excellence Ensure all sales and operational policies and procedures are followed and maintained. Accurately process all POS transactions and capture of customer information and assist when necessary with operational and back of house activities. Adhere to all policies and procedures with a focus on loss prevention and operational excellence. Have a proper understanding of the radio communication and all technology tools used in-store, using proper etiquette. Detailed oriented with ability to multi-task and prioritize work to prioritize work to produce desired outcomes. Prior Experience Needed 1-3 years of experience in a high volume, customer-driven retail environment. Strong personal selling and customer relations experience, along with verbal and written communication skills. Requirements Must have open availability for a flexible work schedule that meets the needs of the business, including overnights, evenings, holidays and weekend shifts. Ability to lift (at least 40 lbs), carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb ladders, crawl, reach, bend and stand for extended periods of time. Must be at least 18 years of age. Core Skills Adaptable – Change before you have to Changes course easily – Knows when to be patient and when to push – Works well in the gray – Shows grace under pressure – Owns mistakes and learns from them – Balances multiple priorities Entrepreneurial Spirit – Own it Takes initiative, doesn’t wait for direction – Builds for the future – Takes personal ownership and accountability – Is resourceful in getting things done Collaborative – No “I” in Tory Is self-aware and open-minded – Integrates the perspectives of others – Is direct but respectful – Communicates cross functionally – Knows when to get people involved and when to make a decision – Takes an inclusive approach Client & Brand Focus – Put yourself in Tory’s shoes Passionate about the brand and the work – Creates a transformational client experience – Makes decisions in the best interest of the company and our customers – Focuses on internal and external customers Live the Values – Being “Buddy” Keeps the “Buddy Values” alive (Kindness, humility, warmth, honesty, loyalty, compassion, integrity, and passion) – It’s not just what you do, but how you do it – Contributes to a positive and productive environment Functional Expertise – Know Your Stuff Has the skills necessary to perform the job – Keeps current on trends, skills, and practices – Puts learning into practice FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS: Team Builder – It’s all about “We” Sets team goals and roles – Develops, motivates and empowers – Delivers constructive and encouraging feedback – Holds people accountable for results – Recognizes high performance FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS: Change Leader – Change is the essence of life Challenges the current point of view – Puts changes in context for the team – Executes changes that impact the business – Is proactive and positive – Listens to and keeps the team up to speed Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.  Disability Accommodation  Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. description: ADCORE (TSXV:ADCO) is a leading global digital advertising company. We specialize in developing machine learning artificial intelligence (“AI”) technologies, that help advertisers and agencies worldwide optimise their Digital Advertising campaigns using our proprietary technologies. ADCORE’s suite of software-as-a-service (“SaaS”) products provide digital advertisers with smart algorithm-powered automation tools to maximize their return on investment, and scale-up their digital campaigns. ADCORE is also proud to be a leading provider of digital advertising services; directly managing the online marketing activities for leading global brands.  We are seeking an enthusiastic and experienced Sales Manager to join our growing Sales team in our newest branch, located in Shanghai. If you are a motivated, talented and dedicated person, we want to hear from you.  You will be responsible for driving new opportunities, providing product demonstrations and negotiating contracts and partnerships.  Key Responsibilities: · Present, promote and sell ADCORE's products & services to existing and prospective customers in Greater China · Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships · Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market  Qualifications: · Prior experience working in the Digital Marketing space – advantage · An outgoing, friendly, driven and a determined person · Strong communication and interpersonal skills · Real passion for sales, networking, relationship building · Native Mandarin and professional level English · 3+ years of prior work experience in Sales - advantage

description: Company Description  The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 402,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2017). The company generated sales of 78.1 billion euros in 2017. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing. It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life.”  Job Description Develop and acquire new business opportunities and new projects. Analyse the competition situation and define the battle plan and winning strategy. Establish good relationship and communication channel with customers, quickly and smoothly solve the customer complaints, handle the customer special requirements, and enhance the customer satisfactory. Take leading position in negotiation regarding all commercial related with customers. Drive the internal processes for new acquisitions including project calculation, cost targeting and so on. Manage accurate monthly forecast and planning. Follow up account payment and receivable. Coordinate the sales team for general task e.g. data collection, delegation. Some other additional task Qualifications Bachelor degree or above 5 years continuous sales experience in automotive industry Good communication and coordination ability Basic technical knowledge of related products and automotive technology Relevant customer experience preferred Willing to travel and take additional task assigned by manager. Good presentation skill is necessary Fluent English in written and spoken

description: At UL, we know why we come to work.  Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!  What You’ll Learn & Achieve  Under direct supervision, the Sales Generalist is responsible for processing orders for products or services from sales staff or direct customer contact. Maintains customer files with sales contacts and other information. Gives price quotations, completes order sheets and ensures prices are accurate. Responds to customer inquiries for the purpose of taking orders. Responsible for processing orders into the ERP after quote acceptance and meeting financial commitments. Ensures that all legal and financial information is collected from the customer before forwarding to service fulfillment. May coordinate with departments regarding order status, prices, product or service availability, and inactive orders. Interacts with customers by responding to order inquiries. Performs other duties as directed. What makes you a great fit: College or above education background. 0~2 years' working experience. Good communication skills and strong sense of customer focus. Good command of English in reading and writing. What you’ll experience working at UL: Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do. People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best. Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world. Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles. Total Rewards: UL offers competitive total rewards including 13 months annual salary, incentive bonus, national mandatory housing fund and social insurances, extended paid annual leaves and paid sick leaves and supplementary medical insurance. Learn More:  Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.  Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit our company page www.UL.com  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Company Description  At Infobip we dream big. Last year, over half of the world’s population interacted with businesses through the Infobip platform. It didn’t happen by chance: through 50+ offices on 6 continents, we are truly committed to helping our 200 000 enterprise clients reach and engage mobile users. Join us in driving the continuous success of Infobip by creating products that our customers love.  Job Description  Why is this role important at Infobip?  As Sales Development Representative you will have the opportunity to be our first impression on all prospective clients in the APAC market. Our vision of greatness in a Sales Development Representative is a brand ambassador that opens doors to all of our target clients, meaningfully filling the top of the Sales funnel, with a competitive drive to succeed.  You know you are doing a good job when you are: Reach out leads and follow up as required Managing Outbound leads, setting up meetings with Account Executives (A and B). Work closely with Enterprise Sales team, defining the best strategy to approach new leads and focus on target verticals. Provide ongoing feedback to the sales and marketing department for continuous process optimization. Use and maintain the Salesforce for data quality. Achieve defined KPI goals. Accept feedback and training to keep continuous development with Inside Sales Team Leader and peers. Identify customer segment and vertical and/or need early in discussion in order to route properly to the Sales Enterprise Team in the region. Support Sales Team with outbound prospect accounts into the A/B segment. Qualifications  More about you: Experience with lead development from first contact of target customers. Minimum 1 year of experience in sales roles. Good sales-oriented communication skills. Robust negotiation skills. Passionate about creating meaningful connections. Creative problem solver with a proven ability to think strategically. Strong administrative and organizational skills, with a focus on metrics supported results. Additional Information  Why our employees choose us (and stay)? Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Learn as you grow – Starting from the Orientation Week as an onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Connect globally – Work with people from different countries, participate in the biggest IT and Telecom events, join us in our Summer Connect conference in Croatia. We put the “global” in globalisation. Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, travel allowances, expatriate compensation packages for your business trips, rewards and holiday bonuses, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team buildings and other organised activities, company library, organised sports, kitchen stocked with the usual suspects… Talk about a balanced lifestyle! By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: Company Description  Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.  Job Description  Are you a self-starter? Do you think different? At Microchip Technology, our values system empowers our employees to develop and thrive in a supportive, collaborative, professional, global, and rewarding working environment. We embrace change and continuous improvement, driving both to the mutual benefit of ourselves and our clients. We are looking for like-minded people who can share our passion for success.  Successful candidate will have Sales Experience in the Semiconductor Industry and be able to work closely with all field personnel to ensure optimum client satisfaction in our efforts to drive design wins to revenue. Responsibilities will include managing multiple large accounts utilizing our systems, acting as main point of contact between client buyers and factories, supporting distributors and representatives as requested by management. Ability to run reports and understand and utilize data within reports is critical. Industry knowledge is important and developing partnerships with field, factories and clients will be the key to success. Candidate must be professional, accurate and dependable, always seeking win-win.  Job Responsibilities Act as Customer Service Representative to support Client Engagement Team (Sales Team) Perform sales coordination activities on daily logistics. Conduct sales administration related Reports, forecast entry etc. Align with Internal Teams and provide timely logistics support Conduct analysis of backlog, demand, supply, inventory Customer Relationship Management – Account profile Order Management i.e. Sample, Order entry, Backlog confirmation/Reschedule, Shipment expedite/notification, RMA Job Requirements  Competencies Time Management – Systematically monitor and scheduling timelines from start to end. Communication – Clear and speed expression among Clients, Factories, Logistic and Client Engagement Managers etc. Qualification And Experience College graduate Minimum 5 years’ experience in Senior Customer Service position (inclusive 3 years in the field of electronic industry is preferred) Excellent written and spoken in English and Chinese Familiar with MS. Office i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint Chinese Word Processing

description: Inspired by kids and imaginative play, ZURU is one of the fastest growing toy companies in the world that is known for it's agility, creativity and new-age manufacturing techniques. Zuru also operates a consumer business, Zuru Edge, delivering disruptive brands in big, stodgy consumer goods categories We are growing rapidly with launch of more successful brand planned ahead in the year and we are inviting analytical, self driven individuals for our Sales Operations team.  The Sales Analyst would be responsible for sales analysis, forecasting, internal and external collaboration with planners and analysts, reporting and supporting sales presentations. As Sales Analyst, you will oversee optimising company item assortment and in stock levels, reporting and coordinating with company supply chain on FMCG shipment requirements and working with FMCG Sales Managers to ensure a successful flow of orders and product.  Job Duties & Responsibilities Working in FMCG environment: ·      Create ladder plans utilizing statistical models, sales projections, POS data, order flows, event calendars, and other market intelligence collected from various business sources including distribution centers to manage and monitor accounts. ·      Pull reports and data to manage each sku and the supply to each store. ·      Recommend and write orders to move product through the supply chain. ·      Analyze store level POS data to identify potential out-of-stock issues ·      Monitor and report on key replenishment metrics, forecast accuracy, replenishment, inventory, and service as indicated by specified retailers. ·      Investigate stocking, delivery, and product activity issues. ·      Manage transfer requirements by location, find root causes and implement solutions. ·      Effectively analyze and execute Inventory Policy settings to support Seasonal Activity ·      Order Management - maintain a high level of accuracy on orders, pricing, execution of allocations, comparison of forecast to trends ·      Analyze corporate, DC, and store level forecasts on continued basis to identify risk and opportunities ·      Compile reports and insights from available third party and retailer data on own brand v competitor brand activities and sales performance including but not limited to promotional tactics, uplift, market share, and present this to sales managers with key recommendations. ·      Assist with scorecard analysis for both internal and external meetings. ·      Assist with key meeting prep.  Desired Skills & Attributes ·      Bachelor’s degree in finance, Mathematics, Business, or related field ·      Strong background and experience with data mining and statistical analysis ·      Minimum 1 year experience as a business analyst or similar role for a FMCG company, with responsibility for analyzing POS-based data and formulating insights and recommendations for retailer. ·      Highly effective at developing presentation materials that are clear, concise, and compelling. ·      Excellent command of Microsoft Office. Very proficient in excel

Distributor validation process and approval matrix. -       Working together with sales team and joint visit to key distributors to enhance competitiveness by deliver trainings and workshops. -       Organize marketing activities such as distributor convention, customer day and seminar. Communication and market information support within sales teams. -       Manage pricing (inc. price list and special price) to improve profit and competitiveness to market. -       Manage CRM process and report to increase sales efficiency.

工作职责: 为关键战略、增长、商业和简化计划提供项目支持。该角色将会与众多客户和职能部门保持联系，以推动项目向前发展，并确保消息传递和方向保持一致。 扩大自己对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群体的认识，以执行政策/策略。不断培养更高水平的知识和技能。 理解关键业务驱动力的基础知识；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 可能具有一定的自主权，从而在定义的框架内进行决策。以良好的商业知识和判断力解决在规定程序中遇到的问题。就定义的说明/参数之外的问题咨询更多的高级团队成员。 此级别的职位需要良好的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。对于面对客户的角色，建立牢固的客户关系并充当客户与 GE 之间的接口。向他人介绍技术信息。 任职条件:  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有初步的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够独立工作。较强的解决问题能力。

description: A Sales Manager analyses local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business.  What will I be doing?  Responsibilities  Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards  As Sales Manager, you will analyse local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business. Analysis local market trends and competitor activity to identify business leads Develop customer accounts and travel within the local area to drive business into the specific hotel/cluster and to increase market/customer share in all revenue streams Negotiate room rates/packages with corporate clients Develop and implement creative local marketing channels, including social media channels Prepare company contracts for the hotel in accordance with current business and pricing conditions Work within current business strategies and recognising potential opportunities Cooperate with other departments in the hotel to create an exceptional Guest experience and build strong, comprehensive sales programs Attend Sales events, as required Produce accurate and timely reports that meet the needs of the Sales Director and senior management to include the reporting of appointments, calls made and business leads Answer customer queries in a prompt and professional manner Manage staff performance in compliance with company policies and procedures Recruit, manage, train and develop the Sales team What are we looking for?  Skills  To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow  A Sales Manager serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. Positive attitude and good communication skills Commitment to delivering a high level of customer service Excellent grooming standards Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations Ability to work under pressure and under own initiative Experience in a sales role with a proven track record to close a sale It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Knowledge of local market Knowledge of hospitality Passion for sales and for achieving targets and objectives Degree-level qualification in a relevant field What will it be like to work for Hilton?  Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!  Work Locations  Hilton Shenzhen Shekou  Schedule  Full-time  Brand  Hilton Hotels & Resorts  Shift  Day Job  Job Level  Manager  Job  Sales
industries: Restaurants, Food & Beverages, and Hospitality

description: Purpose Of The Position  To increase our sales revenue, strengthen our position for both full sheet and parts business in China based PM/TPM (Panel/Maker/Touch Panel Maker) customers;  Day to Day Responsibilities:   To manage the Gorilla Glass and parts business to meet annual sales budget at Key PM/TPM accounts.   Develop PM/TPM strategy and execution plan including but not limit to: o Develop, maintain and improve multi-level and multi-function customer relations. Maxima Gorilla Glass share (including FS & Parts business) by actively working with cross function team (OEM, ODM, Application Engineer, Quality, operation, supply chain and Production Line) through various tools. Identify key program status and develop the strategy to design in Gorilla Glass. Close work with external and internal team to avoid COS issue. Collect and report market information including competitive intelligence.  Provide commercial support to other regions whose supply chain falls into assigned PM/TPM accounts.  Project involved with:   New Projects/product deployment at PM/TPM  Reporting Structure:   Immediate Supervisor: Patrick Fu, Sr. Manager, ODM/TPM/PM Sales, Gorilla Glass Direct reports:  N/A  Education & Experience Bachelor degree with Science or Engineering; 5+ years working commercial experience with 3+ years in electronics industry such as LCD/Touch Panel/Cover Glass/Mobile Phone business. With technical sales or application engineer experience is plus. Required Skills Consistent track record in PM/TPM customer management and familiar with ECO system. Ability to quickly build knowledge of Gorilla products, manufacturing, commercial, and technical processes. Pro-active in anticipating customer’s needs and detail-oriented Self-starter. Confidence in public speaking, direct customer interaction, and leading cross functional teams Good social skills. Ability to interact effectively with multiple external & internal functional areas Ability to leverage past learning’s and business judgment to question/challenge/defend assumptions Bi-lingual fluency in Chinese Mandarin and English. Desired Skills Knowledge of PM/TPM business development & process improvement. Knowledge of Gorilla products, manufacturing, and measurements Commercial experience within the glass and/or consumer electronics industry Proven ability to lead complex projects to successful completion Soft Skills Good communication skills in both Chinese and English (Writing and speaking). Korean is plus. Proven business acumen Strong emotional intelligence. Comfortable working with all levels of management both internally and externally, and with different regions and functions Highly regarded for integrity, ethics, flexibility, teamwork, professional excellence and multi-cultural interpersonal. Ability to set the tone for the organization. High degree of personal credibility and accountability Problem solving skill and analytical skills. Job Selling Points Has the potential to lead the sales team for value chain customers Career Development Opportunities Senior Commercial Manager or team leader at next level Travel Requirements: (National/International; 0-100%) Yes, ~50-60% depend on the business need.

Intensive on-the-job training with expert colleagues guarantees you will quickly become familiar with your duties and perform them independently. Performance related pay and the opportunity for personal and professional development are of course part of the package. Since 2009 Evonik Industries AG has been certified as a family-friendly company by the German Hertie Foundation.  Click here to learn more about Evonik from our employees  Responsibilities  Participating marketing and sales planning within the region of responsibility. Participating trainings provided by the company and other professional training assigned by sales director. Building up customer data base in the region of responsibility and good relationship with customers and image in the market. Developing new customers. Achieving own sales target. Understanding customer needs and applying appropriate commercial and coordinating technical support to meet sales objectives under supervision. Collecting and providing information on market trend, changes of customer need, competitor activities and customer feedbacks. Implement and fulfill the tasks given by sales director.  Requirements  Master degree in Animal Nutrition or related majors. 3 years or more working experience in sales and marketing. Able to understand the market, marketing and sales planning. Understanding basic business concepts and having a business sense. High interpersonal competence and negotiation skill. Communicating at levels from feed mill and integrator to meddle management levels of customers. Good English language skills in speaking and writing.  Your Application  To ensure the fastest process of your application and to protect the environment, please apply online via our careers portal at https://careers.evonik.com.  VACANCY REFERENCE NUMBER 129386  Please note that Evonik will not accept any unsolicited application documents sent by staffing firms. Evonik works in conjunction with preferred service providers and will not pay any fee to staffing firms in the absence of an appropriate framework agreement. description: LINDBERG Precious sales consultant, China   LINDBERG is looking for an independent and energetic individual to be a part of the global Air Force of sales consultants. You will be representing the design brand’s most high-end collection, LINDBERG Precious, for the area of China.   You will be responsible for the sales and development of LINDBERG Precious to our partners. LINDBERG Precious is one of the most premium eyewear collections in the world. The handcrafted glasses are made of 18-carat solid gold or platinum with the selection of exquisite features, including natural horn and top-quality diamonds.    LINDBERG has a unique mindset in the global eyewear industry. We have revolutionised eyewear design more than once, resulting in a vast number of international awards that showcase our innovative way of thinking. As part of our sales team you will get a unique opportunity to be the face of our luxury eyewear brand for our customers in China. We expect you to carry yourself in the presentable way that this responsibility requires.  Responsibilities: -        Service and maintain our partners in China -        Develop the growth of existing and open new Precious collection partners for LINDBERG -        Provide Precious concept training sessions for partners, including luxury storytelling, technical and sales training to position partners at a high-end division -        Establish partners with LINDBERG interior design and visual merchandising solutions of the LINDBERG Precious concept -        Cooperate with the sales and marketing team in Aarhus, Denmark and Shanghai, China -        Manage and coordinate Precious collection trunk shows and events -        Attend international trade shows and arrange regional training academies for our authorised partners -        Meet performance goals and budget -        Ready for life “on the road” and intense travel activity    Qualifications: 2-5 years of experience in the luxury retail business, preferable luxury jewelry/watch background Familiar with GIA diamond grading system and passionate about precious materials Superior communication, strategic marketing and sales skills Strong technical and planning skills Proven track record of boosting revenue Ability to adapt and thrive in a rapidly shifting business landscape You will be working on an independent basis with the primary goal of servicing our partners, as well as developing existing and potential partners in this area for LINDBERG Fluent in Chinese and English. Additional languages are beneficial.  You will have daily communication with our sales and marketing team in Aarhus, Denmark, and Shanghai, China. You should have high energy and strong personal drive with the ability to cooperate with different cultures in an international environment.   We go to great lengths to support and communicate with our sales consultants, as well as organising seminars for our sales team consisting of dedicated and skilled consultants from all over the world.  If you are confident, you have what it takes to succeed in this role, and share LINDBERG’s commitment to teamwork and exceptional results, please submit your CV with a photo of yourself.  LINDBERG is one of the largest players world-wide among the independent, design-oriented high-end eyewear brands. Innovation is the absolute key to the business, where over 100 international design awards are testaments to our way of thinking. We design, develop, manufacture, market and sell LINDBERG eyewear globally to meticulously selected partners in 138 countries. We offer an impressive workday in a company that insources rather than outsources to ensure the highest quality and to keep all the right competencies in-house. Do you want to work in a friendly work culture with many highly skilled colleagues? Find out more about LINDBERG as a workplace and business at www.LINDBERG.com/film

description: Job Summary Works independently under close supervision, responsible for selling products and/or services to a group of clients and identify new and potential customers in order to reach the project profitability and billing levels within an assigned sales territory and/or account. Activities include: negotiation, sale, installation or delivery, and post-sale services. Responsible for securing and maintaining distribution of products and/or services and maintaining effective agreements. MAJOR JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (List in order of importance)  Manage a sales territory on a focused account base. Work as part of a sales team dedicated to this account. Prospect and establish new customers within this account by managing a sales pipeline and developing and delivering proposals to customers by illustrating VWR’s value proposition. Sell consultatively, detailing products, determine customer needs and requirements, and make recommendations to both prospects and customers of the various solutions VWR can offer their business. Work to develop strategic account business plans for achievement of sales growth and quota attainment. Build and sustain relationships with customers and ensure customer satisfaction and loyalty. Manage VWR’s vast product portfolio and execute and implement sales and marketing strategies that you design. Confident in providing and generating Quotations and handling customer returns or complaints. Confident in pulling sales reports in order to have detailed conversations of sales activities, account performance and performance to forecast. Work directly with local manufacturer representatives to develop and continually improve product knowledge, arrive at most favored pricing, and improve account profitability. Perform other duties as assigned.   QUALIFICATIONS (Education/Training, Experience and Certifications)  College Degree or equivalent experience required Some Sales Experience Preferred Business to Business or Distribution Sales Experience Preferred   KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES (Those necessary to perform the job competently)  Excellent communication and team interaction skills, routinely interacting with customers, manufacturers, and VWR staff Ability to carry on a business conversation with business owners and decision makers Ability to handle difficult situations and interactions Ability to work independently and successfully manage time and territory Willingness to travel to customer locations Computer Knowledge (Microsoft Office)   ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL EFFORT (Under Typical Positions)  Typically works in an office with adequate lighting and ventilation and a normal range of temperature and noise level.  Work assignments are diversified. Examples of past precedent are used to resolve work problems. New alternatives may be developed to resolve problems.  A frequent volume of work and deadlines impose strain on routine basis.  Minimal physical effort is required. Work is mostly sedentary but does require walking, standing, bending, reaching, lifting or carrying objects that typically weigh less than 10 lbs.  DISCLAIMER:  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. EEO Statement:   We recognize the value of diverse workforce and aim to create employment opportunities such that all employees achieve their full potential and work in an environment free of discrimination and harassment. We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, caste, color, religious creed, ethnicity, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by central, national, provincial or local laws.  3rd party non-solicitation policy  By submitting candidates without having been formally assigned on and contracted for a specific job requisition by Avantor, or by failing to comply with the Avantor recruitment process, you forfeit any fee on the submitted candidates, regardless of your usual terms and conditions. description: 工作职责:  Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization whereevery voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  角色与职责 负责在某个地理区域内销售产品、服务、零件、解决方案或项目。 利用自身和他人的销售领域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群的深入知识，并运用分析思维和商业经验来执行政策/策略。 具有最佳实践知识以及了解自己的领域如何与他人融合；了解竞争以及在市场上与众不同的因素。 运用判断力，并具有在设定参数之外提出不同解决方案的能力，以解决项目、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户的更复杂的日常问题。为决策制定信息优先级的能力。利用技术经验和分析思维。使用多种内部资源和自身团队之外有限的外部资源来帮助做出决定。 这些销售职位将主要由个人贡献者担任。此级别的职位需要强大的人际交往能力。充当经验较少的同事的资源。可能会领导具有低风险和资源需求的小型项目。说明信息；培养使团队成员就领域的话题达成共识的技能。传达绩效期望，并可以处理敏感问题。 任职条件:  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学历水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Are you inspired by “what’s next”? So are we.  When you join the Albemarle team, you contribute to a better tomorrow. You will play a role in powering many of the world’s largest and most critical industries, from energy and communications to transportation and electronics. We are putting innovation to work to improve people’s lives and we want YOU to be a part of it.  Job Summary  Job Description  Albemarle China Lithium division is projecting significant revenue growth over the next few years, with strong demand from the EV battery industry and Auto OEMs. This role will be focused around understanding the value chain and working with these potential current and new customers. This is an important role for keeping and developing key customers mainly from the lithium-ion battery industry, to assure a long-term relationship and sales growth with key customers. Providing valuable market feedback to the business team will be a key focus area. The individual with develop and implement account plans with clear account strategies and engagement plans while coordinating with the commercial leadership team. This role utilizes the Challenger skills for value selling.  General Responsibilities Manage assigned customers mainly for the electric-vehicle battery industry, including but not limited to long-term contracts and delivery specification negotiations, volume/price management and quality issue coordination. Owns the Albemarle customer interface with assigned customer portfolio as well as new customers within the value chain. This role will nit have direct reports but will lead by influence Achieve/exceed sales objectives through both revenue & profit through value added selling. Develop and maintain account plans for key accounts, through deep understanding of customer value chain and their long-term development plan and competence. Includes the account strategy and engagement plan. Understands the EV battery value chain and communicates timely feedback to the commercial leadership team about competition and market price update, industry segment tendencies, competitive landscape, etc. Successfully negotiate, implement, and secure current and new business opportunities. Forecast accurate sales volume and revenues and meets/exceeds the annual operating plan targets. Build and maintain key customer relationships at various senior management levels and throughout new and existing customer organizations (high, wide, and deep). Develop, teach, and apply Challenger Selling tools and techniques to customer interactions. FUNCTIONAL SCOPE Implement sales strategy effectively and meanwhile able to manage customer expectation from a short term and long-term perspective Good communication internally for aligning sales strategy, product availability, sales process, etc. Able to own and analyze assigned business segments independently Required Knowledge, Skills & Capabilities Organizational skills to communicate and align account activities/goals. Basic knowledge of chemical industry and chemical applications; Lithium knowledge preferred Strong negotiation skills and resiliency to tough situations. Ability to develop relationships and influence across multiple functions of customer organization Understanding of the Challenger Selling principles. Analytical skills to evaluate value chain, risks, growth potential of accounts, etc. Minimum Requirements EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor degree or above Good oral and written English Major in Chemistry/ Chemical engineering is preferred Experience in lithium-ion battery industry is preferred MINIMUM EXPERIENCE IN YEARS: At least 5-7 years sales/marketing experience Choose to unlock your full POTENTIAL . Apply today.
industries: Chemicals and Oil & Energy

description: 概述  As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years now. Today, worldwide more than 7,000 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 90 locations on all continents.  Bruker BioSpin, as part of the Bruker Group, is a high-tech international company and the world-leading manufacturer of complete solutions in Magnetic Resonance Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), Electron Paramagnetic Resonance (EPR) and Preclinical Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).  We develop high-tech analytical measuring instruments and methods that are used in many fields, from medical technology to materials science and food research.  职责  Purpose Of The Job (brief Summary)  The Insides Sales Representative is responsible for driving revenue growth and customers satisfaction within the Bruker Biopsin (BBIO) organization.  Growth needs to be achieved in the broad definition of the BBIO ‘After-market’ product segment. Executing targeted sales campaigns to increase market penetration with our end-to-end portfolio consisting of Consumables, Services, Software, Accessory upgrades and other Aftermarket products and Services.  Engagement in the Pre-Sales phase is also part of the Inside Sales responsibility, including Managing the lead queue from Marcom (inbound) and Generating new leads by identifying and initiating prospect engagement (outbound), Nurturing and distributing to the appropriate Sales representative as defined in Sales Rules of Engagement.  The Primary Objectives Are Top line growth of both Revenue and New order booking Execution of sales campaigns whilst keeping acutely aware of any cross- or up-selling opportunities Contribute to a increase in Net Promotor Score Work in collaboration with the field and market sales, service and application specialists Evaluate marketing-qualified leads and take appropriate actions as described in BBIO lead management and customer relationship processes using appropriate tools Recommend and support changes in processes that improve productivity Duties Develop existing and build new customer relationships ensuring Bruker is seen as a long-term business partner. Work closely with the sales, Market Product Management and MarCom teams to leverage further growth opportunities and identify wins Provide Number of Bookings Forecasts for Inside Sales-owned opportunities Coordinate multi-department projects to meet deadlines Actively participate in an open-communication environment Ensure customer brand consistency and drive customer loyalty to Bruker Ensure sales, finance and legal policies and procedures are met Other duties as may be defined which are broadly in line with the duties and objectives above. Business travels  The work may include occasional travels (within the country and abroad for team meetings at Bruker locations are possible, estimated maximum of 1x per quarter.)  资质  Required Softskills Strong sales-oriented approach to the duties with value generation in mind Tenacity and self-motivation inspired by enthusiasm, drive and initiatives directed towards achieving successful outcomes Self-discipline and the ability to decide priorities in a rapidly changing commercial environment An outgoing and likeable personality with a high degree of personal integrity The personality of a natural team player, willing and able to build confidence and to establish strong co-operative relationships with personnel throughout the company, customer base and with key individuals within the industry A flexible attitude to adapt to the availability of the client A good standard of personal presentation. Required Qualifications (School, University, Trainings) Degree in chemistry, analytical science or physics Degree or Experience in Sales, and/or Leads qualification Experience in the the high technology life science field or NMR Excellent written and verbal communication skills Required Skills And Experiences (IT, Language, Working Skills/experience) Minimum two to three years of proven work experience in an inside sales role or organisation Fluent English, Chinese Creative thinker with a decision-ready attitude to achieve Hands on experience with CRM software SalesForce.com Experience with Outreach sales engagement tool is a plus In-depth understanding of the lead management, customer relationship and sales administration process Computer literacy for document, presentation preparation and report writing Excellent interpersonal communication (both written and oral) skills in local language and English Proven negotiating skills. Ability to deal with people at all levels.
