description: About Our Futures Company  China represents one of the largest opportunities for many of our clients and J.P. Morgan globally and is a critical component of our growth plans in Asia Pacific. J.P. Morgan Futures Company offers a comprehensive set of services and solutions to its clients both in China and globally, providing them with access to China's onshore exchanges to clear listed commodity, equity and fixed-income derivative contracts. With the country's continued liberalization of its financial sector, we are committed to supporting the further development of our clients and China's financial industry.  Overview Of The Role Following instructions from client to execute listed futures and options trades. Providing support for sales activities and able to serve client with valuable market information. Job Description / Responsibilities Be able to follow clients' order instruction to execute the order quickly and accurately. Well manage client's accounts activities day-to day. Provide clients with the latest exchange margin requirement, related research reports, market news and data. End to end handle client's requirements. Customer relationship maintenance and discover new revenue opportunities. Qualifications / Experience Fluency in written and spoken Chinese and English Hold Futures Qualification Certificate. Minimum 2 years experiences of desk dealer experiences. At least 2 years experiences in financial industry. Have experience of servicing institutional clients. Strong domain knowledge of futures & options market. Be familiar with Bloomberg functionalities. Well experienced at maintaining customer relationships. Excellent communication capability in both written Mandarin and English Bachelor degree or above. Good team work and cooperation J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Sales Representative- Market Teams - Food Analysis Solutions
companyName: 布鲁克(北京)科技有限公司
description: 该职位来源于猎聘  The Market Sales Representative - Food Analysis Solutions – (FAS) is responsible for lead execution of the FAS Market Sales strategy in China (The Territory), with the key objective to deliver on defined sales targets (Quarterly) and to drive growth in the FAS Market. They are accountable for defining a Business/Sales Plan to successfully grow BBIO business in stated markets and achieve the business goals defined as per the BBIO strategic Business Plan (5Y).  They will work in close collaboration with the Market Representative FAS, as well as with the Regional Sales group, to define and execute customized Go to Market approaches and to support Key Account sales strategy in the FAS Market, thus enabling BBIO to leverage its full existing Solution Portfolio across customers value chains.  They will deliver the annual and quarterly growth in NOBs and revenue, in a profitable way, and in accordance with BBIO’s annual and quarterly financial objective for the FAS Market in The Territory.  They are responsible for the sales of BBIO total solutions in the FAS market, and potentially specific selected Key Accounts (either in a Global KA sales role or in a regional support capacity). This role will generate sustainable growth by broadening value, with existing and novel solutions (for the customer end-to-end value chain), while strengthening the business and partnerships with established customers.  They have advanced specialized knowledge and understanding of the FAS market and should become a trusted partner for our customers in that segment. They will also develop our business by pro-actively targeting new customers in full alignment within the Commercial Organization.  职责描述： Grow BBIO‘s sales through New Order Booking and Revenue Recognition in The Territory (FAS Markets) by leveraging the full BBIO portfolio relevant to Food Analysis Solution customers. Through building sustainable business partnerships with major corporations in all FAS Subsegments, position BBIO as an End-to-End partner for the complete value chain in the segment and an endorsed supplier in the FAS marketplace. Sell BBIO’s complete solution portfolio, ranging from Food Screeners, software, and services, to Benchtop based Application solutions in all subsegments of the FAS market. Identify a balanced mix of target customers, qualify & maximize BBIO’s business potential for “Designed-In” solutions, and establish sustainable business co-operations with their Decision & Buyer Center in order to deliver business performance (NOB, Revenue, GM) according to the annual and quarterly plan. Act as Key Account Sales Manager for specific FAS Accounts in The Territory that have been assigned. Drive all necessary communication, demo activity, legal requirements, quoting and follow up activities required to close sales in designated opportunities. Focus on penetration strategies for assigned qualified Key Accounts with the goal to achieve “Design-In” projects when possible. For assigned qualified Key Accounts, maintain strong account knowledge and management, ensure that all required resources are utilized in an effective and timely manner to meet the defined customer issue resolution needs (SLS, Back Office) where required. Protect and enhance BBIO’s customer facing reputation. Lead regular interdisciplinary key account task force meetings to resolve pending topics quickly and efficiently. Work in accordance with Miller Heiman Strategic and Key Account Selling Methodologies. Accountable for business results, including annual and quarterly NOB and revenue/market share targets in the FAS Market in The Territory. Own, measure and report sales progress and accurate forecasting within a timely manner through a set of relevant KPI’s within CRM (Salesforce.com). Responsible for implementing the BBIO sales expansion strategies for FAS markets in The Territory. Closely work with Market Manager - FAS and BBIO Marcom to create and execute impactful market lead generation and awareness campaigns in stated region, with the aim of maximising sales growth. Attend specialized events to promote BBIO’s solutions, and assist with the proactive follow up of leads generated Closely work with local Field Application Experts to minimize Sales cycle and time to money for opportunities (time to convert Lead2NOB). Keep abreast of key priorities and changes in FAS Market trends, including changes in regulatory requirements which may pertain to the business, and providing feedback to Global Sales Director - Market Sales – FAS and Market Management, as well as R&D team on a regular basis  任职要求： High level of autonomy, Self-disciplined and reliable, strong time management skills Strong sales-oriented attitude combined with Performance culture High productivity, high quality work Strong drive and enthusiasm combined with can-do attitude Excellent interpersonal skills and teamwork spirit Ability to adapt to change rapidly if needed Strong analytical and organizational skills Problem-solving positive attitude Accessible and open personality Excellent communication (both written and oral) skills Impeccable personal presentation A proven team player with a strong work ethic who will enhance the performance of the BBIO Market Sales team and will complement the capabilities already in place. Must have the ability to react quickly to market requirements with excellent account evaluation and qualification skills. A driven and highly motivated, self-starting sales professional with successful track record in selling high value capital equipment 5+ years’ work experience including minimum 3 years’ sales experience driving and managing a portfolio of technical life science FAS product sales with associated market knowledge of FAS markets Able to demonstrate proven, successful sales experience in increasingly responsible roles across multiple vertical and market segments Successful track record of key account sales management and business growth in FAS/ Academia or an adjacent industry sector. Strong experience of usage and understanding of Complex & Strategic Selling strategies for business development and account share growth. Expertise in value chain management with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities required to diagnosis customer needs and propose technical solutions that address business requirements. Previous exposure to NMR / associated analytical technologies is required. Deep understanding of FAS customer value chains. Has expertise with Value Chain Management and the provision of technical solutions to address a business requirement within in the value chain. Possess and further develop strong network of contacts in stated Market segments Demonstrated experience with cost analysis and justifications required and the ability to present developed business case analysis to executive management. Can demonstrate and convey theoretical and practical understanding of NMR/TD/EPR technology as well as competing analytical tools (MS, IR) Good level of English verbal, written, computer, technical, and proposal communication and presentation skills, including proficiency with MS Office Suite - inc MS Teams Experience daily use and maintenance of Salesforce.com / SAP or similar CRM tool
industries: Industrial Automation

description: l As a member of this team, the qualified individual will be responsible for business development and selling activities for End-users and OEMs in the Food Processing industry. The job will require significant travel in China. Based in Shanghai, this position reports to the China Food Team Leader. l Execute pork market development strategy effectively in China l Develop and drive execution of the targeted company account plans l Maintain responsibility for revenue objectives at the accounts, as well as for reaching the qualitative milestones/objectives as defined and agreed in the account plans. l Build and maintain relationships with key decision makers in both technical and economical functions at the key account / plants in China l Structure creative business packages (technology and services) that tie the company’s best strengths and value propositions with solutions to the customers most critical needs. l Regularly visit customer plants and corporate sites to understand customer’s production realities, identify opportunities where the company can bring value, and introduce products, services, and solutions to customers. l Continuously drive account analysis to strengthen our value proposition/offer to the accounts. l Embrace the concept of team-based selling in performing the job. Look for opportunities to use team and company resources to further develop ultimate goal of selling. l Embrace the concept of “self-management” in performing the above responsibilities.  ² Qualifications  l B.S. or B.A. from an accredited university. Bachelor degree in engineering combined with business education is preferred. l 5+ years in international B2B sales. Experience selling technologies and solutions in food processing industry is a must l Native Mandarin Chinese and fluent spoken and written English. l The ability to travel up to 60%. l Proven track record in large account management; l Strong commercial and analytical skills; Objective critical thinking capabilities. l Energetic and well organized. l Ability to evaluate and effectively pursue strategic sales opportunities. l Strong team player, self-managed and proactive. l Credible; able to develop strong relationships within the target account. l Well-developed communication skills, “shop-floor to boardroom” skill set.

jobTitle: Early Career Program - Sales & Commercial 2022 Opportunities (China)
description: Would you like to learn about customer engagement?  Do you enjoy networking with a wide range of people?  Join our Sales and Commercial team  The Sales and Commercial Development program offers exceptional experiences in sales, sales operations, deal enablement and marketing. Learn about our customers and full-stream product and service capability industry, while making valuable contributions to the organization.  Take your career to the next level  The Baker Hughes Early Career Program in Sales and Commercial inspires and guides recent college graduates through career-shaping experiences. You will be networking internationally and working with colleagues across the world, solving critical business challenges. Learning about customer-engagement, negotiation and business acumen, you will take your career to the next step!  As part of this program, you will be responsible for:  Working on various sales or commercial assignments, from customer-facing sales roles to product management or marketing. Participating in career development and formal training, receiving coaching and mentoring. Networking globally and cross-functionally, leading program initiatives or projects with peers and interacting with global business leaders Solving critical business challenges through cross-functional, mission-based teams Participating in international experiences and assignments  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Mechanics, Economics, Business or Marketing from an accredited university Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a scale of 4.0 (or equivalent) Be fluent in written and spoken English and have effective communication skills Demonstrate strong leadership skills, and the ability to build relationships and network across all levels Be able to travel internationally Be legally entitled to work within the country in which you are applying Show a strong aptitude for and an innovative approach to sales and marketing techniques. Be enthusiastic about working in a challenging, fast-paced environment, with a customer-centric approach  Work in a way that works for you  We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. In this role, we can confidently offer the following flexible working patterns:  Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit in everything in and work when you are the most productive Talk to us about your desired flexible working options when you apply  Working with us  Working at Baker Hughes means being at the forefront of the energy transition. Our people are diverse, ambitious and collaborative. Were on a mission to redefine the energy sector by unlocking the power of engineering, data and science.  The Good Stuff  Our inventions have revolutionised energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace challenge with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:  Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits.  Location  Your first assignment will be connected to one of our main offices/sites in China.  About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  R34811
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Oil & Energy

description: Job Summary Job Summary  As a Tory Burch Sales Associate you are responsible for delivering a transformational customer experience, building our brand one customer at a time and ultimately driving our business through sales. You should demonstrate a strong commitment to service, a genuine curiosity and interest in people, authenticity, fashion & style sensibility, and exceptional selling skills. The ideal candidate also understands how to be a team player, is savvy about the visual and operational aspects of the role, and is committed to loss prevention.  Responsibilities  JOB DESCRIPTION  Drive the Business & Deliver Results Achievement of personal sales and metric goals. Build and maintain new and existing customer relationships. Maintain a solid, organized client book which furthers your customer relationships and generates consistent, proactive sales volume, following the standards of our clienteling philosophy. Be aware of and react to the rhythm of your business, not just relying on walk-in traffic but through clienteling, outreach and event opportunities. Be Buddy/Team Player Lead by example and model behavior that reflects the company’s core values. Appropriately manage conflict and take ownership for your part in the team dynamic. Demonstrate a high degree of maturity and integrity. Contribute to a positive atmosphere that is fun, professional, productive and team oriented. Create The Customer Experience Contribute to an environment that consistently delivers on the five stages of the transformational customer experience. Demonstrate strong use of selling skills. Ensure a high level of customer service through extensive product knowledge and product ownership. Take ownership for the transformational experience in your boutique – customize it for your customer demographic and develop & maintain productive customer relationships. Maintain a “One Company” perspective on charge sends, returns, and other such transactions that are critical to a positive customer experience. Have a thorough understanding and use of the technology tools that support the customer experience Represent the Brand Understand and communicate the Tory Burch brand philosophy and lifestyle with each other and the customer. Emulate the brand aesthetic and embody a strong sense of fashion and an enthusiastic attitude. Contribute to maintaining all brand and operating standards to support brand consistency. Assist in maintaining store presentation standards. Leverage in-store technology to ensure every customer’s experience is transformational. Operational Excellence Ensure all sales and operational policies and procedures are followed and maintained. Accurately process all POS transactions and capture of customer information and assist when necessary with operational and back of house activities. Adhere to all policies and procedures with a focus on loss prevention and operational excellence. Have a proper understanding of the radio communication and all technology tools used in-store, using proper etiquette. Detailed oriented with ability to multi-task and prioritize work to prioritize work to produce desired outcomes. Prior Experience Needed 1-3 years of experience in a high volume, customer-driven retail environment. Strong personal selling and customer relations experience, along with verbal and written communication skills. Requirements Must have open availability for a flexible work schedule that meets the needs of the business, including overnights, evenings, holidays and weekend shifts. Ability to lift (at least 40 lbs), carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb ladders, crawl, reach, bend and stand for extended periods of time. Must be at least 18 years of age. Core Skills Adaptable – Change before you have to Changes course easily – Knows when to be patient and when to push – Works well in the gray – Shows grace under pressure – Owns mistakes and learns from them – Balances multiple priorities Entrepreneurial Spirit – Own it Takes initiative, doesn’t wait for direction – Builds for the future – Takes personal ownership and accountability – Is resourceful in getting things done Collaborative – No “I” in Tory Is self-aware and open-minded – Integrates the perspectives of others – Is direct but respectful – Communicates cross functionally – Knows when to get people involved and when to make a decision – Takes an inclusive approach Client & Brand Focus – Put yourself in Tory’s shoes Passionate about the brand and the work – Creates a transformational client experience – Makes decisions in the best interest of the company and our customers – Focuses on internal and external customers Live the Values – Being “Buddy” Keeps the “Buddy Values” alive (Kindness, humility, warmth, honesty, loyalty, compassion, integrity, and passion) – It’s not just what you do, but how you do it – Contributes to a positive and productive environment Functional Expertise – Know Your Stuff Has the skills necessary to perform the job – Keeps current on trends, skills, and practices – Puts learning into practice FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS: Team Builder – It’s all about “We” Sets team goals and roles – Develops, motivates and empowers – Delivers constructive and encouraging feedback – Holds people accountable for results – Recognizes high performance FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS: Change Leader – Change is the essence of life Challenges the current point of view – Puts changes in context for the team – Executes changes that impact the business – Is proactive and positive – Listens to and keeps the team up to speed Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.  Disability Accommodation  Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require assistance or an accommodation with the hiring process, please contact talent@toryburch.com .

jobTitle: Product Sales Specialist, Hong Kong and South China
description: Sr. Product Sales Specialist - Hong Kong & South China  We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, confident team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!  Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 350,000 customers and almost 2 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products, and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  As Sr. Level Product Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for positioning and selling Meraki revenue in the Hong Kong and South China market. Through ambitious prospecting, finding opportunities, and collaborating with Cisco account teams and partners, drive deals through close delivering on and exceeding quarterly quota. Success will be dependent not only on your ability to sell but also on the relationships you develop with regional channel partners and Cisco account teams. This is a high-energy position requiring you to be deeply motivated and results driven with a hunter mentality; it will also require someone who is equally comfortable working in a strategic and tactical capacity.  What You Will Do Passionately discover, manage and close deals and consistently remain highly results-oriented in the market space Maintain and lead detailed and accurate quarterly forecasting Work in a highly collaborative environment to team with Cisco Account Managers, Sales Engineers, Marketing, and Channel Partners to drive revenue and contribute to ambitious YoY growth rates Develop a predictable pipeline of short, mid, and long-term business. Help to exceed expectations by identifying impactful user cases that enable people to transform their businesses with Meraki solutions. Promote your customers and ecosystem around you on the concept of cloud-managed networking for digital business. Empower and build extended teams around you to unlock the power of Cisco’s Sales organization, customer base and partner organization. Show up every single day with willingness to learn, a real passion for customer delight, and a desire to have fun while improving the lives of others  Who You Are Speak fluent Cantonese and business level English. 8+ years technology sales experience in a field sales capacity. Consistent track record with detailed quota attainment. 3+ years over achievement Strong executive presence including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to large and small audiences. Knowledge within Industry and ability to make confident recommendations at C-level, business decision makers. Bachelor’s degree with exposure to Information Technology ( or equivalent). MBA desired. Based in Hong Kong or Guangzhou, China. 50% travel required.  Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Huntsman’s Advanced Materials Division is now searching for a new Account Manager - Power Industry, who will implement the sales plan in Power (Heavy Electricity) Industry and deliver the target business objectives year on year. To be successful in this role, you must have the ability to develop and maintain key customers and achieve determined sales objective in line with forecast. This role is an active, full member of the Huntsman Advanced Materials Commercial team, located in Shanghai.  As The Account Manager - Power Industry, You Will Ensure that all activities are performed in line with Huntsman’s EHS, Corporate compliance standards, local and National regulations and laws Accomplish sales budget and develop new sales opportunity. Maintain the customer’s relationship with particular focus at Global Key Accounts. Provide preliminary technical & application service to customers. Collect market and competitor’s information. Process customer complains and coordinate with relevant parties for prompt response. Skills And Experiences Required  Education: Degree in Electrical Engineering or Chemical, MBA is preferred  Experiences: About 10 years of in chemical fields. Experience in electrical or electronic industry is preferred.  Know-how/Skills Strong technical knowledge in heavy electrical application and chemistry Fluent in English, Mandarin Able to work with multicultural team, Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint, and Internet Huntsman offers unsurpassed opportunities to build a successful future. Our diverse portfolio creates a range of career fields including manufacturing, research and development, technical services, sales and marketing, customer service – and the list goes on.  Here, you can make an impact and make a difference. Come join us.  Huntsman is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation and/or expression or any other characteristic protected by law in every location in which we have facilities national or local.  Please refer to https://www.huntsman.com/privacy/online-privacy-notice for Company’s Data Privacy and Protection information.  All unsolicited resumes presented by recruitment agencies are treated as pro bono information or service.  Huntsman is aware of a scam involving fraudulent job offers. Huntsman does not make job offers until after a candidate has submitted a job application and has participated in a face-to-face interview. Please be advised that emails from Huntsman always end in “@huntsman.com” and that any job offer that requires payment or requires you to deposit a check is likely a scam. If you have questions about any open positions at Huntsman, please visit our Careers website at http://www.huntsman.com/corporate/a/Careers.

description: Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a pioneering technology leader that is helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep the factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn from others. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation  For our Marketing, Sales and Product Management team, understanding the full potential of our technology and the trends in our markets is highly rewarding. In addition, helping customers all over the world improve efficiency, save resources and reduce emissions gives our work a powerful sense of purpose.  Your Responsibilities Responsible for customer relationship maintenance and the sales development of the HVDC business in relevant area and segment. Identify all the opportunities for sales growth in terms of HVDC and to manage the relevant projects which are launched to address these opportunities. Prepare and negotiate quotations and proposals and ensure good margin and terms. Lead the capture team during tendering phase. Maintain good relationship with customers in the relevant region. Work closely with the relevant organizations within Hitachi ABB Power Grids. Collect marketing information, regular report to management, action plan following. Other jobs assigned by sales director. Living core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.  Your background A Bachelor’s or above degree in electrical engineering, power system automation or related majors is required. At least 10 years of experience in power system or power product field Have sales experience, familiar with HVDC control and protection systems, experience on power product manufacture, maintenance are advantages. Fluent in Chinese (Mandarin) and English, written and spoken. Frequent traveling in region, O/T work at request, teamwork oriented, ability to work independently, good communication skill in verbal and writing.  More About Us  Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a global technology leader with a combined heritage of almost 250 years, employing around 36,000 people in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, the business serves utility, industry and infrastructure customers across the value chain, and emerging areas like sustainable mobility, smart cities, energy storage and data centres. With a proven track record, global footprint and unparalleled installed base, Hitachi ABB Power Grids balances social, environmental and economic values, and is committed to powering good for a sustainable energy future, with pioneering and digital technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. www.hitachiabb-powergrids.com  Grid Integration
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing and Information Technology and Services

description: Location:  Gopher Center (歌斐中心), Huangpu District, Shanghai  About This Role  As the Pre-sales Consultant, you will be a crucial member supporting our Enterprise Sales Team - the division that drives our highest value growth opportunities throughout the region. Majority of our clients at Meltwater are on the SaaS subscription model, however for our top percentile of clients who have a greater need for customisation, Meltwater’s APAC Enterprise Sales is the dedicated team to consult and deliver curated solutions for their unique business needs.  Your primary responsibility as a Pre-sales Consultant is to work with our Enterprise Sales team on the presales and delivery stages of a sales cycle for complex solution offerings. In addition, you will be responsible for developing project cost estimate and scoping proposals.  With the largest global mainstream news and social media source base, we enable any analysis to be built on top of the most complete data set possible. We surface these insights through our web & mobile applications, reports and alerts, and enable our clients to integrate it with their internal systems through Meltwater’s APIs.  What You Will Be Doing Support the Enterprise Sales team in the development of cases in their pipeline and management of sales opportunities from lead generation to closure Work with the Enterprise Sales team on the presales stage for complex deals, such as preparing collaterals & pitch decks, creating mock-ups, doing demos, and sharing relevant case studies Own presales activities till solution delivery stages by understanding, communicating, and interpreting client’s requirements and business processes. Thereafter, you will need to deliver and present Proof of Concepts (POC) when necessary Meet clients and post-meetings, you will need to develop a solution proposal that includes project scope, assumptions, implementation plan, technology solution options, and recommendations in addition to costing / pricing estimates Fully understand the clients’ business agenda and in turn, provide useful and constructive feedback to Engineering / Technical Consultant to fine-tune and customize solutions for clients Work as a solution advisor to provide guidance on governance, strategy, and transformation Render support in tender writing, RFP processes, final offer negotiations Facilitate and coordinate the sharing of use cases from individual sales reps to the whole of Enterprise Sales team We would love to see Bachelor’s Degree (in any discipline) with strong academic results Entry level / have 1 - 2 years of relevant experience in consulting, business analysis or client-facing industry. Proficient in using Microsoft Excel. Passion for entrepreneurship & technology, SaaS industry & media intelligence, and you should be a regular consumer of the news / media Good to have prior experience with software demonstrations Some exposure to sales processes from prospecting to closing of deals Excellent written and spoken English Good interpersonal, communication and stakeholder management skills Self-motivated, proactive, initiative and organized with the ability to work under tight deadlines and in a high-pressure environment Team player, mature, and a self-starter Keen eye on how to use data analytics to improve clients’ business impact You enjoy and have experience in data analysis and creating presentation decks What We Offer Meltwater offers a very competitive compensation plan with accelerating commissions and tremendous upside earnings potential that has no cap. Prizes, competitions, and additional sales incentives. 20 Days paid holidays Comprehensive training program. New hire training programs, conference, seminar, up skill session, business case sharing session for your personal and professional growth Fun, ambitious and international working environment Team activities and events About Us  Founded in 2001, headquartered in San Francisco, Meltwater is the global leading AI-powered media monitoring, social listening & PR Analytics software. Our mission is to help companies make better and more informed decisions. With over 2000 employees and 55 offices globally, we help over 30,000 companies to stay on top of billions of online conversations, extract valuable data, and consult our clients to transform their businesses in this new digital reality.  Meltwater is recognized as a great place to work for talents globally. We have won several Top Employer awards worldwide and most recently been accredited as “Asia's Best Multinational Workplaces”, “Best Companies to Work For in Hong Kong”, “Best Companies to Work For in Greater China” by Great Place to Work™.  Meltwater operates the Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST), a nonprofit organization devoted to nurturing future generations of entrepreneurs. MEST has invested over $20million into training 400+ individual entrepreneurs and invested in over 50 early stage tech startups. Learn more about us on https://www.meltwater.com/  and https://outsideinsight.com/
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Online Media

description: 岗位职责： 1. 负责团队组建及管理，制定并执行销售策略与计划，激励和领导团队完成指定业绩目标； 2. 负责拓展和维护自有客户，有效开发新客户及渠道资源； 3. 针对高端客户提供财富规划方案，并根据客户的资产规模、生活目标、预期收益和风险承受能力进行需求分析，为其制定家庭保障方案； 4. 了解和掌握香港保险产品及行业动态，为客户提供专业、准确、全面地讲解以促成业务，并协助在业务落地前后期进行全方位的跟进服务，保证良好的客户满意度； 5. 可参与集团公司基金、债券、家族办公室等各类业务的拓展。  任职要求： 1. 具有3年以上金融从业背景，有香港保险业务拓展经验者及有团队者优先； 2. 具备一定的团队经营能力及管理经验，有丰富的客户或渠道资源基础； 3. 强有力的自律和自我驱动力，具有高度的团队合作精神和工作热情； 4. 个人亲和力及语言表达能力强，并具有较强的逻辑思维及主观判断能力； 5. 良好的市场开拓能力和客户沟通能力，优秀的客户关系管理及营销技巧。  公司介绍： 德林控股集团是一家总部位于香港，并在上海、旧金山及新加坡设有常驻办事机构的一站式金融服务集团。集团公司持有香港证券及期货委员会牌照，可从事第一类（证券交易）、第四类（就证券提供意见）、第六类（就机构融资提供意见）和第九类（资产管理）受规管活动。集团包括：主板上市公司德林控股有限公司(1709.HK）、德林家族办公室、德林证券及另类投资基金，为客户提供定制化的全球家族财富传承管理及投资银行服务。  本公司为香港上市集团德林控股旗下财富管理公司，致力于为大中华地区高净值客户提供全方位的财富管理和生活方式服务及咨询。本公司拥有多领域的资深专业人才队伍，为客户提供多元化及个性化定制服务。服务内容涵盖资产配置、海外保险、身份规划、税务安排、教育咨询、健康管理及艺术品收藏管理等，以满足客户全方面的高品质需求。  本公司是持有香港专业保险经纪协会（PIBA）牌照的财富管理公司，为客户提供各大保险公司的经纪服务，根据客户实际情况匹配最佳保险方案。公司向财富管理机构及独立理财师提供一站式全球资产再配置服务，并提供包括产品培训、售前咨询、售后服务等全环节的全球保险支持服务。

description: We’re looking for a sales specialist to join our Special Lighting team in ShenZhen.  Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.  As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!  Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.  As a sales specialist you’ll be responsible for key account management and new business/application development .  We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!  What You’ll Do Coordinates the involvement of Signify personnel, including support, service, and management resources, in order to meet account performance objectives and customers’ expectations. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume, customer satisfaction (NPS) and strategic objectives in assigned SPL key accounts Proactively leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for a one and three-year period. Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis. Collaborates effectively with SPL partners, alliances and stakeholders in the eco system. Your Qualifications Bachelor degree or above Marketing or sales background Fluent English skill We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.  See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: Who We Are  Airwallex is a technology company that revolutionises the way businesses operate globally. Our financial infrastructure provides a modern technology stack for businesses to operate internationally, without the challenges of the current global financial system.  Businesses use Airwallex as their end-to-end global financial services platform. Whether it’s making or receiving payments from customers, domestically or internationally, Airwallex saves businesses time and money by offering real-time, reliable and cost-effective financial solutions. Our web and API solutions support businesses of all sizes, from small companies to large enterprises.  In this fast-changing digital world that is increasingly becoming borderless, our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes to grow in their own markets and around the world, and by doing so, contribute to the global economy.  Who You Are Build and deepen executive relationships with enterprise customers. Influence long-term strategic direction, and serve as a business partner. Negotiate and manage entire complex sales-cycles, often presenting to C-level executives in corporate and global customers. Lead account strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities, working collaboratively with Airwallex Partners. Actively understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans and business drivers, technology strategy and competitive landscape. Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle. Help to drive product innovation based on your experience and feedback from clinets. Skills And Experience You Will Bring Bachelor’s degree and above. Very strong communication skills (both internal and external). 10 years and above of experience selling infrastructure software, databases, analytic tools, or applications software. Experience leveraging C-level relationships. Experience working with and managing partners in complex implementation projects. Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and have a level of maturity to run your own race within the organization. Excellent written and verbal English & Chinese. Prior experiences in B2B, payment, or professional service industries will be a plus.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: The Saurer Group is a leading globally operating technology group focusing on machinery and components for yarn processing. As a company with a long tradition, Saurer has always been a leader in innovation. Today, Saurer comprises the two segments Saurer Spinning Solutions and Saurer Technologies. Saurer Spinning Solutions offers high quality, technologically advanced and customer-specific automation solutions for processing staple fibre from the bale to the yarn. Saurer Technologies is specialized in twisting and embroidery as well as engineered and polymer solutions. With annual sales around 1.0 billion EUR, 4,000 employees and locations in Switzerland, Germany, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, USA, China, India and Singapore, the strongly growing group is well positioned to serve the world’s textile industry centres.  Design with us the way to industry 4.0. As a company with many years of tradition, we combine high development standards in mechanical engineering with the technologies of the future. For the Business Unit Elastomer Components, we are looking at the next possible time for you as  Sales Manager  Job reference 2018-0122  Job description  Basic understanding of company’s regulations procedures Intensive travelling to responsible area as to promote Elastomer Components Organization and provide product training to agents and OEMs, as well as end users Order follow-up process including visits, project establishment, contract negotiation and conclusion Close coordination with related departs, sales admin and production sites as to monitor the whole order process Payment follow-up Handling actively customer complaints Customer relationship management Reports as request on projects, orders, sales result, lost order, etc Market and competitors’ analysis Working closer with service as to achieve a high customer satisfaction rate Participation to exhibitions and seminars   Requirements  Graduates majoring in Textile Engineering  5 years’ experience in machinery or parts sales in textile industry  Basic understanding of the spinning process and related machines, basic communication skill and good written in English, basic knowledge of using emails and Office software  Spirit of teamwork, cooperation and continuous improvement  The Saurer Group, founded in 1853, is a leading, globally active technology company with a focus on machines and components for yarn production. As a company with a long heritage, textile machinery, automobiles and engines have been all important parts of the company's portfolio during the historical development of Saurer. Saurer has always been an innovation leader. Today, Saurer consists of two segments: Spinning Solutions, which offers high-quality, technologically advanced and customer-specific automated solutions for staple fibre processing from bale to yarn, and Saurer Technologies, which specialises in twisting and embroidery solutions as well as engineering and polymer solutions. With around 4 700 employees, the Saurer Group, with locations in Switzerland, Germany, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, the USA, China, India, Uzbekistan, and Singapore, is well equipped to serve the world's textile centres. Saurer is listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange.  Robin Luo  Saurer (Jiangsu) Textile Machinery Co. Ltd.  No. 9 Chang Yang Street  Suzhou Industrial Park  Jiangsu Province  215024 Suzhou  China  www.saurer.com
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Machinery, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: The key role of this position is to lead the evolution of in-direct service model via accelerating wholesaler management and RTM construction as effective complements to existing service model; acquiring more new customers to expend the outlet coverage from Key and A cities to B cities by 2025, driving pervasive distribution and finally establishing a hybrid RTM model as a fit-for-purpose RTM solution for China. Need to work very closely with Commercial team, marketing team, and supply chain and operation teams to build the capabilities that create system competitive advantage in RTM.  Thought Leadership Shape the China relevant in-direct service vision, strategy and solutions, in the context of China market reality Develop feasible implementation plans with sales team to realize the strategy and solution in real market Leverage global and local best practices and adapt it into relevant solutions to China market Lift-shift-scale mindset to build system capability Key Responsibilities Develop and integrated vision and strategic roadmap for in-direct service model in China to drive horizontal/vertical sustainable revenue/volume growth and align it across all senior key stakeholders in company Build competitive advantage in more developed urban markets with KA/DS RTM approach, while explore more cost efficient and effective wholesaler solution in the less developed urban and rural markets Initiate trade partner wholesale to distribute premium portfolio in F&B channel, design the management playbook, commercial policy, trade incentive plan and loyalty program Secure measurable and sustainable Segmented Execution initiative expansion across all channels/regions, by leading the alignment and deployment of effective, efficient capabilities and process, capable to adapt the project to market realities Give ground support on RTM Project Implementations, leveraging knowledge of all RTM Process and document requirements. Through this, identify gaps and best practices to provide inputs for a conjoint plan development Communication Complexities: This role manages the strategic conversation and alignment with senior internal and external stakeholders. Disseminates information both internally and externally. Strategic negotiation is required with multiple parties externally Analysis: The role is required to solve complex business issues which involves multi geographies, multi channels and the full value chain. The role is constantly required to develop wholesaler management solutions and is responsible for managing the operational, financial and organizational aspects. Responsibilities are typically stated as broad goals or areas of accountability. There is substantial latitude in determining how to accomplish the goals The Role Should Develop Solution That Will: Secure we maintain the horizontal expansion by leveraging in-direct service model, while we accelerate our vertical growth and enhanced execution model for a much broader portfolio Keep driving sustainable growth of controlled outlet across the system while gaining revenue, volume and share in the market Create, deploy and embed the Route-to-Market world class capabilities disseminate and internalize across the company Initiate new business solution to transform wholesaler as the trade distribution partner to reach unserved outlets, unleash growth potential and seeking for fit-for-purpose RTM approach Judgment And Decision Making: Personal responsibility/accountability for decision making Fully involved and accountable for the development and execution of Sinodis 5.0, create aligned set of strategies, framework, process, approach, solutions and will be responsible of execution on it across the system Innovation: RTM will require ongoing innovation in processes and tools to stay ahead of the competition. Specifically, for this role, the individual will need to be intellectually curious and willing to try and then scale new capability building approaches for RTM, define and implement new framework, process and commercial solutions to address complex business needs in terms on in-direct service model Key Requirements 8+ years business experience in relevant position, with field sales experience is preferred(especially in food service channel) Significant cross functional experience, including route to market, commercial, mixed area management, franchise, finance, sales operations, and business development Proven Strong team leadership skills Ability to work effectively across multiple functions and cultures, including KA/DS management, Wholesaler Management, Trade marketing management and sales operation Understanding of supply chain and technical aspects of food service business Experience in facilitation of multi-disciplinary teams Fluency in English and Chinese The candidate should be able to work across multiples cultures (Asian / Western) Travel requirement: Around 30% of total time

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Description  Supports sales force through reporting, system administration and internal & external data analyses by executing, supporting and improving selected activities under limited supervision.  Reporting  Consolidates and distributes repetitive sales reports, creates ad-hoc sales reports under limited supervision.  Revises templates, consolidates data from others, provides as forecasting input under limited supervision.  System Administration  Runs complicated tasks, documents ad-hoc tasks on systems and tools (e.g. salesforce, WWSPS, BMS, Portal) under limited supervision.  Periodically evaluates the user-entered data hosted on the systems to ensure completeness and identifies improvements.  Data Analyses (External & Internal)  Analyses external sources (e.g. Polk, Dodge, RigDig, etc.) to identify sales opportunities and forwards them to the sales team.  Reviews the findings from research on assigned opportunities, shares with relevant teams.  Compiles and qualifies competitive data, communicates to sales force per relevancy.  Conducts internal sales analyses (e.g. variances, projections, costing, bundling) for ad-hoc and repetitive tasks.  Skills  Qualification & Experience:  Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.  Action oriented - Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.  Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.  Ensures accountability - Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.  Education, Licenses, Certifications  High school diploma or certificate of completion of secondary education or equivalent experience to the extent such experience meets applicable regulations.  This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.  Experience  Requires significant relevant work experience or specialized skills obtained through education, training or on-the-job experience.

description: About Us  Founded in 2005, EyeBuyDirect, a subsidiary of Essilor-Luxottica, is a leader in the fast growing and competitive online prescription eyewear industry. We’re on a mission to become the world’s most loved online eyewear brand and a one-stop-shop for all your prescription eyewear needs!   Our Culture Our vision is to make quality eye care accessible to everyone, improving our customers’ lives and thereby being the world’s most diverse ecosystem for optical consumers.  Our core values are: Do More with Less Open, Diverse and Transparent Measure Improvement & Reward Achievement One team (we win and fail together) Think Big, Be Bold and Quick   Career Opportunities  At EyeBuyDirect, we’re all about making possibilities available to everyone - and that includes our employees! We’re able to offer a wide range of career paths, whether you aspire to move from one department to another or to take on more managerial responsibilities. Your hard work and ambition will be rewarded here.  Our employees are our greatest strength, and we’re very committed to developing their skills at EyeBuyDirect through local development programs and professional training courses. We also encourage our talented team of multinational professionals to be creative and collaborative while bringing their unique experience to their work.   It’s a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where teamwork, quick thinking and a “can-do” attitude make all the difference. Sound like a place for you? Then, come for the challenge and stay for the growth at EyeBuyDirect!  Background At EyeBuyDirect, we want to create a better vision for people’s everyday life.  We were founded on the belief that quality eyewear should be accessible, and more importantly affordable, to everyone. The ability to see shouldn’t be held at a premium when it’s such an integral part of our daily lives.  It's this vision that we were founded on in 2005, and one that continues to drive our success today. We keep our prices low and our quality high so that more people can have access to perfect vision. Ultimately, we aim to be the best eyewear solution for everyone in the world.  Summary EyeBuyDirect is looking for a Product Coordinator with a strong business mindset, and communication skills in Operation Team. The role reports to the Senior E-commerce Product Manager and offers great career opportunities for the ideal candidate.    Job Responsibilities Select styles to launch for designer brands, such as Ray-ban, Oakley, Vogue etc… from Luxottica Group Select styles to launch on Amazon (from EBD current inventory or from spot goods of vendor) Sales forecast  Submit order form to vendor Product upload and information maintenance, description and picture QA Monitor sales and inventory Replenishment tracking, shipment coordination Return check and follow up Invoice check and follow up Daily communication with high level staffs from Luxottica on alignment at global level and execution for promotion according to commercial calendar   Qualification 3+ years of experience as a buyer or similar business-related position  Excellent spoken English is a must  Number oriented and good at Excel. Good execution and alignment on global strategy

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025. description: Farnell  Farnell, an Avnet company, is a global high-service distributor of technology products, services and solutions for electronic system design, maintenance and repair.  Job Summary  Combines inside sales/customer service and technical/systems knowledge to sell products, services and solutions to new, lead generation opportunities and existing customers/account base through a variety of outbound multimedia communications (e.g., telephone, email, fax, portals). Effectively develops and manages trusted relationships for assigned customers/accounts. Promotes company options and solutions to customers on a regular basis. Identifies sales opportunities to deliver focused market/brand solutions to the customer resulting in increased market share, sales and margin for suppliers and maximizing value to the Company. Consistently delivers revenue or profit that supports and drives the account/customer to meet financial sales metrics.  Principal Responsibilities Delivers solutions or finds new opportunities for a positive customer experience utilizing independent judgment, lead generation, and sales methodology. Directs secured sales opportunties to the proper stakeholder(s), if required. Initiates sales inquiries directly to prospective and/or existing customers to promote product offerings, services and capabilities. Promptly, directs, and accurately responds to prospective or existing customer information requests. Monitors/follows up on sales activities throughout the process to meet or exceed customer requirements from initial contact to order fulfillment. description: Here at AppsFlyer, it’s all about the people, each and everyone of us has our own speciality, a unique flavor that we bring to the table. We are all driven individuals whose interests are just as diverse as we are. You could say we’re #PeopleObsessed. When we say obsession, we mean we will do everything to make you feel those AF vibes; whether it’s company breakfasts, happy hours and parties, our connection to each other is always a core focus.  We are seeking a customer-obsessed and highly-motivated problem solver to join our Customer Success Team. In this role, you will help customers work through their issues from onboarding, implementation to adoption and expansion at scale to maximize customer success. Be ahead of the curve by sharing new product releases or content relevant to their business. Listen to their feedback in order to improve documentation and video tutorials. Ultimately, you’re there to serve as a guide towards successful AppsFlyer adoption and expansion through enablement and training activities.  What you’ll do Be the primary point of contact for a book of customers and continually delight them with a positive, customer-obsessed attitude Provide support to customers from onboarding to adoption on all levels: technical, business and product Develop an expertise in AppsFlyer product and help customers understand the benefits of of AppsFlyer Provide training and education on our products and new features through demos and webinars Use your understanding of the AppsFlyer product to quickly identify, escalate, and solve customer problems Collect customer feedback to improve overall customer experiences Work closely with Sales, Support and other teams to ensure an exceptional customer experience Drive upsell through increased product adoption and increased usage What you have Relevant experience in online advertising company or SaaS Martech platform Passion and understanding for digital marketing, product and technology Experience working with multiple accounts and clients Excellent written and verbal communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences A fast learner who is naturally curious and thrives in a fast paced and dynamic work environment Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills Ability to understand and articulate technical concepts and come up with solutions Mother-tongue Chinese plus strong business level spoken and written English Bonus points Being introduced by an AppsFlyer team member is a plus! Product management sense/familiarity As a global company operating in 16 countries across 5 continents, we reflect the human mosaic of the diverse and multicultural world in which we live. We ensure equal opportunities for all of our employees and promote the recruitment of diverse talents to our global teams without consideration of race, gender, culture, or sexual orientation. We value and encourage curiosity, diversity, and innovation from all our employees, customers, and partners.  “As a Customer Obsessed company, we must first be Employee Obsessed. We need to make sure that we provide the team with the tools and resources they need to go All-In.” Oren Kaniel, CEO
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description  The Optical Solutions Group is looking to hire an Inside Sales / Sales Operation team member who will be responsible for working with and supporting the local Sales and Order Management teams. The position will report into the Regional Sales Manager.  Responsibilities: Coordinate with and support the Sales Manager during the renewal quoting process in addition to various customer development activities. This role will have responsibility for the creation of the Customer Master, Order Entry, and the submission of Off-Support and Rehost requests to Order Management. The role will also be responsible for issuing Trial Licenses, Bridge, Training and Emergency keys along with the submission of Export Control documentation.  This person will manage the end to end inside sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Regional Sales Manager, Senior Managers, Product Marketing, Sales Ops, Legal, Marketing and Credit. They will help coordinate the generation of short-term results through the renewal process while maintaining a long-term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Assure accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery.  Why work for the Optical Solutions Sales Team : We provide cutting edge software solutions used to design optical systems in consumer electronics, general lighting, aerospace, microlithography and automotive. Many of the digital personal devices we use every day are designed using our software.  We build on our core values of “People, Passion, Performance.” At Synopsys, you will live a team responsibility process that focuses on win-win solutions as the norm and not the exception. You will experience a collaborative working environment with some of the brightest minds in both the software and optics fields and have plenty of opportunities for training, learning and career growth with dedicated mentoring provided by our experienced team members.  Preferred Experience 3 to 5 years of Inside Sales / Sales Operations experience in the Optical Design Software market Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Bachelor’s degree The Synopsys Optical Solutions Group provides design tools that model all aspects of light propagation. With intelligent, easy-to-use solutions and an expert support team anchored by optical engineers, Synopsys helps organizations deliver superior optics to market faster. Our innovative software packages include CODE V® imaging design software, LightTools® illumination design software, and the LucidShape® products for automotive lighting. We are integrated with RSoft™ Photonic Device Tools for streamlined, multi-domain co-simulations of nano-textured optical structures and diffraction analysis. We offer optical design services, with more than 5,500 completed projects in imaging, illumination, and optical systems engineering. And our optical measurement solutions give customers access to precision light scattering data for materials and media used in optical systems. Learn more at https://www.synopsys.com/optical-solutions.html .  At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.  Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability
industries: Semiconductors, Computer Software, and Computer Hardware

description: The Company The world leader in mineral-based specialty solutions for industry, with over 16,000 employees and over 200 sites worldwide, Imerys delivers high value-added, functional solutions to diversified set of industrial sectors, from processing industries to consumer goods. The Group draws on its knowledge of applications, technological expertise and its material science know-how to deliver solutions based on beneficiation of its mineral resources, synthetic minerals and formulations. These contribute essential properties to customers’ products and performance, including refractoriness, hardness, conductivity, opacity, durability, purity, lightness, filtration, absorption and repellency. Imerys is determined to develop responsibly, in particular by fostering the emergence of environmentally-friendly products and processes. If you want to grow your skills and develop your career, find out more at www.imerys.com The Position Sales Manager, PRPA China  Job Summary JOB DIMENSION / 职位范围 Key Relationship/主要工作关系 Internal对内： Customer Service, Supply Chain, S&OP, Finance, Marketing, Technical Service, S&T External对外： Develop new customers Maintain and increase the business with incumbent customers. Collect market and competitor’s intelligence to develop new customers Monitor Purchasing Orders with support from Customer Service team Visit customers with an efficient business plan and manage the travel cost properly within budget JOB SPECIFICATIONS / 岗位任职要求 Knowledge Typical Education Level/教育背景： Bachelor degree in chemical related major is a minimal requirement. Sales experience in inorganic fillers for plastic is preferred. Technical knowledge in the plastic compounding industry is preferred including formulation and processing. The knowledge of paint, rubber and ACS is a plus. Skills and Attributes / 能力、个性特点和素质 ： Able to communicate in English including dialogue, report writing and presentation Open minded, well organized, self-motivated, transparent and integrity Good at learning new knowledge and applications Extensive travel per business needs is required Position Type Full time and Permanent Only technical issues will be monitored through the below inbox: recruiting.support@ imerys.com PLEASE DO NOT SUBMIT RESUMES OR APPLICATIONS TO THIS EMAIL, AS THEY WILL NOT BE REVIEWED. description: Overview  Kemin Industries Inc is a global cooperation headquartered in Des Moines, Iowa, USA. Kemin Industries, Inc. consists of a number of market foucused and regionally located companies that specialize in delivering technology – based solutions to our customers worldwide. The Kemin commitment to research and technology sets us firmly apart from other companies. Our commitment to innovation and superior service empowers our staff to reach out to our customers with quality products as well as new and better nutritional solutions in industries such as Agrifoods, Pet Food, Dietary Supplements & Nutraceuticals, Pharmaceuticals, and Personal Care. Kemin strives to “improve the quality of life by touching half the people in the world, every day, with our products and services.” Kemin Industries, Inc., has annual worldwide sales in excess of $200 million and employs over 900 people.  Kemin China is headquartered in Zhuhai, a beautiful costal city in the south of China with easy access to Macau and Hong Kong. Kemin China is a young, growing company. The company produces and supplies a broad range of quality products such as enzymes, antioxidants, acidifiers, mold inhibitors, flavors, surfactants, and pigments from its leading – edge manufacturing facilities in Zhuhai. Kemin’s leading brands in China include Kemzyme, Endox, Acid Lac, Myco Curb, Feed Curb and Oro Glo.  Responsibilities Responsible for the development of heilongjiang market sales plan and the completion of sales tasks; Responsible for the management and training of dealers in the region; Coordinate the company's resources to provide customers with reasonable and in place technical support and services to meet customer requirements; Develop new markets and ensure that sales in the region increase year by year at a rate higher than market growth; 主要职责: 负责拟定黑龙江市场销售计划，完成销售任务； 负责区域内经销商管理和培训； 协调好公司资源,为客户提供合理、到位的技术支持与服务，满足客户要求； 开发新市场，确保区域内销售以高于市场增长的速度逐年增长； Qualifications Bachelor degree or above, major in animal science, animal nutrition or related; 2 years or above related working experience, additive sales experience is preferred;  Familiar with Heilongjiang market, small and medium-sized customer relationship is preferred; Integrity, honesty, initiative and diligence, team work spirit and sales passion; Good communication skills and ability to work under pressure. 职位要求: 本科及以上学历,动物科学、动物营养等相关专业； 两年及以上相关工作经验, 有添加剂销售经验优先； 熟悉黑龙江市场，有中小型客情关系优先； 正直、诚实、主动和勤奋，有团队合作精神和销售激情； 具备良好的沟通及能力、抗压能力。 working location : Heilong jiang

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Job Summary  职位描述  EXFO is seeking a dynamic, self-motivated tele salesperson to drive the business and customer engagement process within our smaller accounts. An integral member of one of the geographic Sales Districts but sitting within the office-based sales group you will work closely with the territory sales managers supporting their business through the remote management of transactional opportunities within their large base of smaller yet important accounts. The role is measured and remunerated against a sales target (which is a subset of the territory managers targets to avoid conflict). The ideal candidate will have a level of technical acumen, commercial drive and experience of selling remotely.  EXFO 现招聘对接公司的较小型客户的销售，帮助推动业务发展和客户参与，要求热情礼貌，积极主动。作为指定地理销售区域的重要成员，您将被分配到办公室销售团队中，与区域销售经理密切合作，通过远程管理他们庞大的重要小型客户群中的交易机会，支持他们的业务。该岗位根据销售目标衡量和支付报酬，为避免冲突，您的销售目标将与区域销售经理有明确的定义。该岗位的理想候选人需具有一定的技术敏锐度、商务动力和远程销售经验。  What you’ll do  工作职责 Partnering with the territory sales managers within the assigned sales district you will be targeted and commissioned for remotely driving all business from the district small accounts list. Activities will include: 在指定销售区域中，与区域销售经理合作，负责远程推动该区域小型客户群名单上的所有业务。业务活动将包括：. Developing relationships within those accounts  与客户建立良好关系   Driving opportunities from lead through to close  争取将潜在客户转化为成交客户   Maintaining the records for your accounts in a CRM  在客户关系管理系统 (CRM) 中维护客户记录   Driving supplemental business through campaigns  通过开展活动来推动业务   Driving supplemental business through enhanced digital media promotion and footprint (Linked-In) across your accounts  通过对客户群加强数字媒体推广和足迹（领英）来推动业务   Focused lead generation campaigns targeting market application  以市场应用为目标，对有针对性的潜在客户开展活动   Provide a monthly forecast and performance report for the small accounts within each territory of the district in collaboration with the territory manager.  与区域经理合作，针对销售区域内各地区的小型客户群体提供月度预测和业绩报告   Collating the current leads and cooperate with partner and regional sales manager to drive leads to opportunity  整合目前的潜在客户名单，并与伙伴和地区销售经理合作，将潜在客户转化为销售机会 Perform other duties as the Company may authorize or assign from time to time 执行上级交办的其它任务  What we’re looking for  职位要求 Skills & aptitudes 技能和能力 A love of sales! A drive for closing deals and winning PO’s 热爱销售！积极完成交易和争取订单 An engineering or technical background 工程或技术背景 Strong entrepreneurial spirit - recognizing and capitalizing on opportunities 强烈的企业家精神 - 能发现和把握机会 Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to prepare and deliver professional documents, consult with customers via phone and web-based presentation. 优秀的口头和书面沟通能力，包括准备和交付专业文件，通过电话和网络与客户协商的能力 Sales acumen and qualification skills 销售敏感度和资格技能 Opportunity management experience 机会管理经验 Highly motivated, enthusiastic and adaptable 有高度的积极性、热情和适应能力 Autonomous, well organized, and results-oriented 有自主性、条理清晰，以结果为导向 Able to interact with people at all levels 能与各级人士沟通 Ability to collaborate with supporting teams remotely 能与支持团队进行远程协作 Pertinent Experience：  相关经验 Experience in Telecommunications 电信方面的经验 Tele-Sales and consultative sales experience 电话销售核顾问式销售经验 Distribution channel knowledge related 分销渠道相关知识 E-commerce knowledge related 电子商务相关知识 Other Requirements  其它要求 Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. 优秀的英语书面和口头沟通能力 Highly proficient in MS Office suite 熟练使用微软办公工具 Education Background  教育背景 Engineering or Science Degree 工程或理学学位 Any other combination of experience/studies will be considered. 任何其它经验/学习经历将予以综合考虑

description: Job Description Summary  You will drive segment performance with clear product development thinking, conduct market intelligence to better understand competitor dynamics and build KOL relationship. GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  •    Drive segment performance with clear product development thinking.•    Conduct market intelligence to better understand competitor dynamics.•    Build KOL relationship. •    Launch NPI locally and set implementation strategy. •    Create and manage show site. •    Prepare effective sales tools for sales team.  Qualifications/Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in Bioengineering, Clinical & Medicals, Radiography and other related field. At least 5 years of solid experience in healthcare industry, taking various commercial roles, with a track record in either Sales or Marketing functions Strong Communication capabilities, including the relationship with KOL and team building (internal and external)    Good marketing sense with applied skills Good command of selling skills, including negotiation and communication  Inclusion and Diversity   GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
