description: Clarivate(tm) is a global leader in providing solutions to accelerate the lifecycle of innovation. Our bold mission is to help customers solve some of the world's most complex problems by providing actionable information and insights that reduce the time from new ideas to life-changing inventions in the areas of science and intellectual property. We help customers discover, protect and commercialize their inventions using our trusted subscription and technology-based solutions coupled with deep domain expertise.  We now have more than 8,500 colleagues in over 40 countries worldwide, and we work with over 200 partners to deliver value and success for our customers. Today, Clarivate is a publicly traded company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker NYSE:CLVT.  Clarivate is committed to building, nurturing, and developing a diverse culture of belonging where new colleagues can bring their authentic self to work every day! Join us!  Duties And Responsibilities  Drives revenue growth of Life Science products and solutions by meeting or exceeding both new sales and retention goals on monthly and quarterly basis To maintain/grow existing subscriber base through renewals and build an extensive pipeline of new opportunities. To contact new leads generated from marketing campaigns, exhibitions, conferences, seminars, customer enquiry and online usage data, analyse information requirements and maximise new business revenue. To be proactive in the self generation of new leads to maximise new business revenue through regular calling of newly identified prospects (Hunting). Account management, and growth through upsell and cross-selling activity Builds strong “trust” relationships with clients, creating trust and confidence at multiple levels, including users, key contacts, managers and business leaders, to increase revenue and sales opportunities. Work with Manager to develop a strategy plan for the region which includes an analysis of revenues/products, strategy for growth, objectives and implementation schedule. To liaise effectively with internal departments to maximise sales opportunities, including Product Development, and to keep up to date with existing and new services and marketing/sales campaigns. To maintain and update sales progress reports and other administrative reporting mechanisms according to agreed timeframes. Ensure you have a strong understanding of competitor products and services and how we can successfully position ourselves against them. To take responsibility for identifying training and developmental needs for yourself on an on-going basis.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:  Experience selling in the Life Sciences space in a solution sales capacity Understanding of sales in a software, workflow and content technology environment strongly preferred Strong execution focus and ability to develop solutions and strategies to further accelerate growth in untapped markets A university degree in relevant course work AND 5+ years proven sales experience working for a Life Sciences information/software/services company, with a strong aptitude for technology Experience conducting effective product demonstrations & sales presentations Ability to build & maintain relationships with existing and prospective customers Experience working in a team sales environment Outstanding oral and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate easily & interpersonally with Senior Executives and C-level decision makers Capable of thinking creatively and making independent decisions Effective time management skills Well organised and disciplined with regards to policy, procedure and standards Can set priorities and be flexible in changing environment. Ability to report and project accurately and according to agreed timeframes. Ability to identify problems and apply creative solutions Confident, outgoing personality Heavy travel requirements (approx. 50%)  It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Pharmaceuticals, and Information Services

description: 公司概述&岗位目的  豪顿是一家全球性工程公司，致力于为客户提供工业产品，帮助其改善日常流程。 豪顿的核心宗旨是为空气和气体处理提供高质量的解决方案，并在该领域拥有超过100年的经验。  作为销售工程师，根据公司销售计划，分析市场需求和竞争态势，获取客户需求，拜访客户，推荐豪顿华产品，开拓蒸汽压缩机销售机会，推动公司整体的业务发展，以促成公司销售目标达成。  你的工作是什么？  1、积极拜访业主和客户，获得项目信息。熟悉风机的选型，和报价部一起为客户提供最佳的解决方案，维护良好的客户关系，为获取新的销售订单创造机会；  2、和客户进行合同谈判，确保合同条款和订单条件满足公司法务规定，满足的公司的价格利润水平；  3、积极的开拓市场，寻找新的市场机会和产品应用，获取市场的最新动态和竞争者的最新信息并迅速传递给相关部门，以协助公司获取新的市场机会；  4、检查报价部门的标书，保证标书内容符合公司相关规章、政策，且能最大化公司利润；  5、在合同签定之后按规定将合同项目及时按照公司规定交接给项目执行部门，并且将项目细节交接给被任命的项目经理/工程师，确保合同的顺利执行；  6、协助项目部和财务部与客户沟通付款情况，确保客户付款及时收到；  7、按照公司要求定期更新月报和周报，并按时提交给直线经理，汇总负责区域的全部进行中的、完成的和失去的项目，分析失败的原因和成功的经验，提出建议以提高销售成功概率。  我们对你的期待是什么？  工科背景，机械、热能动力、化工机械或环境保护类相关专业，本科及以上学历；  5年以上工作经验，3年以上销售经验，压缩机销售，蒸发设备行业，（任一）工作经验，有蒸汽压缩风机销售工作经验优先考虑；  良好的沟通和谈判能力、较好的团队协作能力、具备一定的英文听说读写能力、基本的计算机及办公软件操作能力，适应经常在外出差。  你将获得什么？  您将有机会在具有良好发展前景的全球性集团公司工作，可以获得富有挑战性的岗位和广阔的发展空间。 同时，我们将提供具有竞争力的薪资待遇以及良好的福利体系。  在豪顿工作有什么优势？  全球业务–你将与我们在27个国家/地区的同事一起工作。  我们提供全球和本地的工作机会– 6000名员工和世界领先的工程师，他们创造了最前沿的发展–你将成为160年创新和发展的一部分，数字化解决方案使我们立足于今并且持续进步。 在豪顿，我们拥有强大的企业形象和目标–您将成为我们团队的一员，一起创造世界的未来，一起解决全球面临的一些最紧迫的问题。我们的产品和组织一直在您身边–我们的文化是促进个人发展，使我们最重要的资产–我们的员工 得到全面提升。

description: Job Summary Job Summary  As a Tory Burch Sales Associate you are responsible for delivering a transformational customer experience, building our brand one customer at a time and ultimately driving our business through sales. You should demonstrate a strong commitment to service, a genuine curiosity and interest in people, authenticity, fashion & style sensibility, and exceptional selling skills. The ideal candidate also understands how to be a team player, is savvy about the visual and operational aspects of the role, and is committed to loss prevention.  Responsibilities  JOB DESCRIPTION  Drive the Business & Deliver Results Achievement of personal sales and metric goals. Build and maintain new and existing customer relationships. Maintain a solid, organized client book which furthers your customer relationships and generates consistent, proactive sales volume, following the standards of our clienteling philosophy. Be aware of and react to the rhythm of your business, not just relying on walk-in traffic but through clienteling, outreach and event opportunities. Be Buddy/Team Player Lead by example and model behavior that reflects the company’s core values. Appropriately manage conflict and take ownership for your part in the team dynamic. Demonstrate a high degree of maturity and integrity. Contribute to a positive atmosphere that is fun, professional, productive and team oriented. Create The Customer Experience Contribute to an environment that consistently delivers on the five stages of the transformational customer experience. Demonstrate strong use of selling skills. Ensure a high level of customer service through extensive product knowledge and product ownership. Take ownership for the transformational experience in your boutique – customize it for your customer demographic and develop & maintain productive customer relationships. Maintain a “One Company” perspective on charge sends, returns, and other such transactions that are critical to a positive customer experience. Have a thorough understanding and use of the technology tools that support the customer experience Represent the Brand Understand and communicate the Tory Burch brand philosophy and lifestyle with each other and the customer. Emulate the brand aesthetic and embody a strong sense of fashion and an enthusiastic attitude. Contribute to maintaining all brand and operating standards to support brand consistency. Assist in maintaining store presentation standards. Leverage in-store technology to ensure every customer’s experience is transformational. Operational Excellence Ensure all sales and operational policies and procedures are followed and maintained. Accurately process all POS transactions and capture of customer information and assist when necessary with operational and back of house activities. Adhere to all policies and procedures with a focus on loss prevention and operational excellence. Have a proper understanding of the radio communication and all technology tools used in-store, using proper etiquette. Detailed oriented with ability to multi-task and prioritize work to prioritize work to produce desired outcomes. Prior Experience Needed 1-3 years of experience in a high volume, customer-driven retail environment. Strong personal selling and customer relations experience, along with verbal and written communication skills. Requirements Must have open availability for a flexible work schedule that meets the needs of the business, including overnights, evenings, holidays and weekend shifts. Ability to lift (at least 40 lbs), carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb ladders, crawl, reach, bend and stand for extended periods of time. Must be at least 18 years of age. Core Skills Adaptable – Change before you have to Changes course easily – Knows when to be patient and when to push – Works well in the gray – Shows grace under pressure – Owns mistakes and learns from them – Balances multiple priorities Entrepreneurial Spirit – Own it Takes initiative, doesn’t wait for direction – Builds for the future – Takes personal ownership and accountability – Is resourceful in getting things done Collaborative – No “I” in Tory Is self-aware and open-minded – Integrates the perspectives of others – Is direct but respectful – Communicates cross functionally – Knows when to get people involved and when to make a decision – Takes an inclusive approach Client & Brand Focus – Put yourself in Tory’s shoes Passionate about the brand and the work – Creates a transformational client experience – Makes decisions in the best interest of the company and our customers – Focuses on internal and external customers Live the Values – Being “Buddy” Keeps the “Buddy Values” alive (Kindness, humility, warmth, honesty, loyalty, compassion, integrity, and passion) – It’s not just what you do, but how you do it – Contributes to a positive and productive environment Functional Expertise – Know Your Stuff Has the skills necessary to perform the job – Keeps current on trends, skills, and practices – Puts learning into practice FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS: Team Builder – It’s all about “We” Sets team goals and roles – Develops, motivates and empowers – Delivers constructive and encouraging feedback – Holds people accountable for results – Recognizes high performance FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS: Change Leader – Change is the essence of life Challenges the current point of view – Puts changes in context for the team – Executes changes that impact the business – Is proactive and positive – Listens to and keeps the team up to speed Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.  Disability Accommodation  Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require assistance or an accommodation with the hiring process, please contact talent@toryburch.com .

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Role and main responsibility  跟踪、掌握所负责区域市场、康众门店、修理厂渠道状况以及博世易损件产品售出状况，并进行业务分析、制定业务计划、提升博世易损件市场份额  遵循博世销售工作方法，对所负责区域内康众门店及修理厂，进行定期拜访维护和业务推进  对所负责区域内康众门店、合作修理厂及天猫养车门店提供专业的产品培训及售后支持  达成所负责区域博世易损件年度、季度和月度售出目标  达成所负责区域的修理厂项目发展目标，并推动合作修理厂达成其签约采购目标  达成所负责区域天猫养车渠道的博世易损件产品覆盖目标，并推动合作天猫养车渠道达成其签约采购目标  在所负责区域内合作修理厂及天猫养车门店，开展重点产品售出的市场活动  完成相关的其他事务性工作  Requirements  2年以上行业销售经验（主流轮胎或油品经销商的销售岗位背景更佳）  大专以上学历  结果导向的意识和追求成功的强烈欲望  良好的沟通能力  良好的执行能力  良好的时间管理能力  一定的数据分析能力  基本的办公软件使用技能，尤其是EXCEL

description: 公司概述&岗位目的  豪顿是一家全球性工程公司，致力于为客户提供工业产品，帮助其改善日常流程。 豪顿的核心宗旨是为空气和气体处理提供高质量的解决方案，并在该领域拥有超过100年的经验。  作为销售工程师，您将维系并开拓除大型火电市场以外（MT/IM/PCOG 等行业）风机、空预器、压缩机、鼓风机等产品备件&服务&改造市场，建立良好的客户关系，给客户提供良好的备件、服务、改造和售后支持，完成压缩机、鼓风机、风机、空预器等产品备件&服务&改造销售目标。  你的工作是什么？ 收集和跟踪区域内除大型火电市场以外（如钢铁/石化/化工/医药/纸业/污水等行业）压缩机、鼓风机、风机、空预器等产品备件&服务&改造销售机会，定期拜访客户，开拓风机&空预器&压缩机改造市场，收集、跟踪改造信息。 负责区域内除大型火电市场以外（如钢铁/石化/化工/医药/纸业/污水等行业）压缩机、鼓风机、风机、空预器等产品备件/服务/改造的对外报价，负责询价、报价、投标、合同的签订以及项目交接。并积极推动 LTSA 和 DDA。 定期回访客户，保持与客户的沟通，保持良好的客户关系。 保持与工程部、应用分部、报价部和项目管理分部的沟通，保持良好的关系。 按规定建立、保存和管理相关信息文件和档案，汇总客户信息，维护 CRM 系统，定期向销售经理汇报工作。 我们对你的期待是什么？  工科背景，机械类相关专业者优先，专科及以上学历，本科以上学历优先；  3 年以上行业经验者优先。有钢铁、石化、化工等行业背景优先；  英语可较熟练的进行书面沟通；  熟悉风机、压缩机、鼓风机等相关机械产品知识、较强的沟通能力、较强的谈判能力、较好的团队协作能力、较好的英语听、说、读、写能力、有服务意识，基本的办公软件操作能力。  你将获得什么？  您将有机会在具有良好发展前景的全球性集团公司工作，可以获得富有挑战性的岗位和广阔的发展空间。 同时，我们将提供具有竞争力的薪资待遇以及良好的福利体系。  在豪顿工作有什么优势？  全球业务–你将与我们在27个国家/地区的同事一起工作。  我们提供全球和本地的工作机会– 6000名员工和世界领先的工程师，他们创造了最前沿的发展–你将成为160年创新和发展的一部分，数字化解决方案使我们立足于今并且持续进步。 在豪顿，我们拥有强大的企业形象和目标–您将成为我们团队的一员，一起创造世界的未来，一起解决全球面临的一些最紧迫的问题。我们的产品和组织一直在您身边–我们的文化是促进个人发展，使我们最重要的资产–我们的员工 得到全面提升。

description: Job Description  Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds  Position Title: Channel Sales, Analyst/ Associate  Location: Fozhou/Xiamen, China  Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 747 offices in 42 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values based on integrity, excellence and giving back. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  Morgan Stanley Huaxin Fund Management Co., Ltd. (“Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds”) has changed registration with the Industry and Commerce Bureau on June 12, 2008 and is now Sino-foreign joint venture funds management company (formerly known as Jutian Fund Management Company established in 2003) with registered capital of RMB 227.5 million. Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds is headquartered in Shenzhen, and has two branches, one in Beijing and the other in Shanghai.  “Gather World Wise, Achieve Ideal Life”. As a joint venture fund management company, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds benefits from the global vision of its foreign shareholder, Morgan Stanley, and absorbs the local investment wisdom from its Chinese major shareholder, Huaxin Securities. Supported by both foreign and domestic shareholders, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds has devoted itself to becoming a leading asset management company in China. Established in Chinese market and benefiting from its international background, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds commits itself to building a harmonious, normative, transparent and progressive corporate culture and providing fund investors with good investment returns and professional services.  Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds provides diversified and professional investment management services to fund investors, including actively managed products, indexing investment products, quantitative investment products, fixed income products and separately-managed account (SMA) products, with a goal to meet investors’ needs for asset allocations, risk management and producing investment returns.  Responsibilities Responsible for business development and sales channel maintenance with Financial Institutions (both Banking and NBFI channels) in East China region; Work closely with relevant parties in product development, launch, and promotion; Act as the contact point for clients, and service regional clients’ needs; Customize investment products and provide investment advice to client’s; Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above from top universities. Master’s degree in a Business related subject is preferable; Sound knowledge in the fund industry in general, and conversant in the firm’s product offerings; At least 2-3 years’ sales experience in to Financial Institutions (both Banking and NBFI), preferably with major domestic banks; Good communication and interpersonal skills, and a strong sense of customer service Able to travel for work;

description: About the Role SWIFT APAC Pre-sales division is seeking high caliber to join our dynamic team in Beijing office. Working in collaboration with commercial managers, the Technical Sales Expert will provide technical pre-sales, implementation and project management support for achieving sales objectives. It is a client facing role, being the technical and product 'go-to person' within sales teams, is responsible to propose SWIFT solutions to clients and support their implementation.What to expect: Perform product demonstrations. Demonstrate value of SWIFT technology solutions versus alternatives. Explain SWIFT solutions roadmap's at customer sites, working closely with sales Provide pre-sales information. Present SWIFT products and technology solutions at customer events Meet with customers to understand detailed level needs and requirements, prepare proposals and validate with senior team members to make recommendations on best practice solutions for medium size/complexity/risk projects Maintain and develop knowledge of architecture/design technologies, integration and future industry trends. Provide resiliency and security advice. Overcome objections of a technical nature Translate business requirements into a Project Plan with full involvement of the project team. Analyze detail systems factors: input/output requirements; information flow; technical requirements; resources needed and select the appropriate SWIFT products and services to build a customer proposal Monitor, maintain and report to team, customers and project office on the project status on a continuous basis and for the duration of the project Re-validation of the business requirements translation of a project. Ensure the project stays on track by pro-actively controlling actual status of cost, schedule, quality, resources versus plans and by taking corrective action for issues under his/her direct control Review status of all (region) projects on a regular basis, escalating all exceptions Assist with the ordering, provisioning and software license procedures. Assist with preparation for installation and integration activities. Ensure a smooth handover to Customer services Build and develop working relationships with customer management responsible for the customer SWIFTNet infrastructure Analyze customer escalated problems, develop and propose solutions to customer Represent SWIFT at SWIFT user groups, seminars and workshops In line with team objectives, support (region) teams by defining processes, transferring knowledge for the SWIFT platform as well as SWIFT Solutions. What will make you successful: University degree in Computer Science or IT related fields 5 to 10 years experience in presales, project/programming software development, scoping and writing Customer Requirements Specifications, High Level Design, Functional Requirements Specification Experience in Banking industry or IT vendor will be great advantage Fluent in English and Mandarin, excellent communications and presentation skills Good team player as well as the ability to work independently Good to have: Experience in SWIFT products, services and solutions Experience in market infrastructure (central bank, stock exchange, clearing house, central securities depository) systems or operations Experience in working with a multi-cultural and international team environment You may like to know the team better by knowing the people in the team. Review LinkedIn profile of the people on the list below:  Nie Jing - Pre-sales manager  Bill Doran - Head of Oceania and Customer Solutions APAC  Polly Ip - APAC Recruiter  What we offer  We put you in control of career  We give you a competitive package  We help you perform at your best  We help you make a difference  We give you the freedom to be yourself  We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion, or veteran/military status.

description: JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelor’s degree) in a related discipline plus generally eight years of directly related experience. 2. Extensive knowledge of company policies and sales processes. 3. description: When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the leader in our industry, achieving double-digit growth by helping clients make the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development — as well as unlimited growth potential. If you like working with a generous, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is where you want to be.  About this role: As a Portal Specialist you will be responsible for receiving and translating Gartner system invoices into the Chinese Government portals. In this role, you will have the opportunity to partner closely with our Order Management and Collections teams, as well as the Chinese Government Tax Authority.  What you’ll do:   Review finalized invoices delivered by the Order Management Team and process through the Government e-billing systems.  Ensure local billing (VAT Fapio) is issued in accordance with the contract and ensure delivery of the invoice to the customer (by courier)  Preparation of local China VAT report to ensure that the number of local VAT invoices (FAPIAO’s) match the number of Gartner system invoices issued each month in China.  Work with various Government departments to resolve system/portal issues and resolve issues related to invoice/VAT Fapiao  Manage portal vendor relationship to ensure portal maintenance and notification of changes, enhancements, etc.  Any other duties assigned by the supervisor.   What you’ll need: Associates Degree or equivalent work experience preferred. Intermediate English listening, speaking & writing 1-2 years of related office experience in one of the following areas: Customer Service, Collections, Sales Support, and Accounts Receivable. Ability to build strong internal/external business partnerships, being able to communicate internal & external smoothly with easy going personality. Strong ability to collect information from many varied sources and ensure its accuracy Impeccable attention to detail and Self-driven awareness Knowledge of Oracle and a CRM system is a plus Proficient in all Microsoft Software Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment Excellent time management skills and ability to meet tight deadlines. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
industries: Information Services and Management Consulting

jobTitle: Enterprise Sales - Data Sales Development Representative, Shanghai
description: We're Bloomberg Enterprise Solutions - fast paced, innovative and expanding. We have worked hard and smart to become the business we are today. We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses and individual data and technology needs. Our extensive selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling mean our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Without us, they simply can't operate.  What's the role?  Our sales development representative (SDR) team helps bring new Enterprise Data Sales talent into the department, trains them across the various complexities of our Enterprise Data business, and develops them to be the sales force of tomorrow. As a sales development representative, you will be responsible for lead generation, new business strategies and marketing, managing the day to day relationship with large accounts as well as hunting for growth opportunities. The career path associated with the Sales development role generally leads into an experienced Sales position.  We'll Trust You To Generate leads across Mainland China for the Enterprise Data Sales team Frequent engagement in prospecting calls to existing accounts and new business to create a pipeline and identify new opportunities to grow revenue Establish and maintain efficient processes to assist in the smooth day to day Data Sales team operations and administration Build a depth of understanding around a customer's business, workflows and technology stack Build a depth of understanding around our Data product features, solutions and benefits and how they align with the point above Leverage this knowledge to build and maintain client relationships to deliver revenue generating and adoption/usage goals Build credibility with our clients by being informed about the evolving data and financial markets landscape You'll Need To Have 2 to 5 years of client facing experience in Financial services or Financial technology in the past 5 years Experience supporting institutional clients with their market data and technology needs Hands on experience using the Bloomberg product suite Ability to identify opportunities to grow existing business relationships Experience in building and maintaining relationships with stakeholders both externally and internally Hands on experience using the Bloomberg product suite Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation Strong presentation and communication skills in Mandarin & English If This Sounds Like You  Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know the next steps but in the meantime feel free to browse this: https://blpcareers.com  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity of thought and perspective in every form. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  As Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer, please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.

description: 职位描述和职位要求  Air Products and Chemicals, Inc.  Position Description  Position Title : CryoEase Area Sales Manager Reports To : Commercial  Director  Group Division : Gases Group – Asia Date :  Prepared By : 1 st May  Allan Li  Department : NWAP China Commercial Reviewed By : Rosa Ren  Approved By : Lionel Liu  Position Summary  Purpose  Execute our business strategy for our MicroBulk business model in Northern and Western China, increase our density and market share, maintain the profitability and the leading position in Sh anxi P rovince . The incumbent should lead the whole shanxi sales team to achieve new signing, customer retention, pricing and overall margin enhancement target.  Nature and Scope  The role is the key to lead a 5~20 sales to continue our leading position of CryoEase offer in shanxi province.  This p osition requires well grounded technical, commercial, leadership and influencing skills to drive and develop the team needed to stay on course and within boundaries of low cost business structure. It will also require creative approaches to problem solving necessary to operate as small business unit within a company business environment.  Direct Reporting To The Job Holder Are  5 Sales Engineer.  DIMENSIONS  Revenue: US$1 MM/Year in FY20 （new area for us）  Growth Rate: Projected 35% per year for next 5 years (revenue basis)  Market Size: Forecast annual revenue is around USD30MM  Total ship to ~no less than 150 ship-to growth every year  This Position Is Accountable For The Following  PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES Execute business strategy and continue to enhance the CryoEase Disruptor Business Model. Maintain AP as the leading position for the CryoEase offer in the area by increasing density, marketing share, and profitability. Directly lead the area sales team, indirect lead customer retention sales and work with company support function to achieve annual business target. Develop the sales team and maintain the leading position in the organizational level. Manage the partner relationships – OEM and strategic customers Maintain accountability for business results – monitor results vs plan and if necessary, take action to stay on course Create and implement offering enhancements – telemetry, auto-delivery , managed gas invoicing and other best practices or market differentiating tactics as they surface Is accountable for the margin enhancement activities, maintain and improve the margin. Adapts safe practices in every aspect of the workplace. Ensures compliance with all safety procedures, rules, and objectives. Incorporates safety-related responsibilities into employee job descriptions and evaluates performance against their objectives. Reports all negative safety-related observations. Other works and projects assigned by supervisors or the company. Job Requirements Education University education (in business or technical area preferred) an engineering, finance, marketing and/or management discipline . Work Experience At least 5 years of progressive commercial experience in multinational companies. Need 3 years successful experience as the CryoEase Sales. Skills Sales, commercial, and negotiation skills Strong leadership and communications skills, including written and spoken English and Chinese (Mandarin) and listening and presentation abilities. Qualities Strong result-oriented leader with a bias for action and ability of taking risk. Well developed influencing skills. Ability to get along well with diverse personalities. Concise, strong , mature, and flexible. Leadership capabilities – disciplined, process oriented and can build a positive team environment. Integrity – act with integrity and in accordance with company ethics. Ability to confront behavior not consistent with company values. Honors commitments. Problem solving and decision-making skills – decisions that reflect thorough evaluation of needs, goals, facts, etc., Result focused – demonstrate ability to reach goals, accountability for results, demonstrated ability to manage through company network, assertive, clear notions of efficiency. description: Clarivate(tm) is a global leader in providing solutions to accelerate the lifecycle of innovation. Our bold mission is to help customers solve some of the world's most complex problems by providing actionable information and insights that reduce the time from new ideas to life-changing inventions in the areas of science and intellectual property. We help customers discover, protect and commercialize their inventions using our trusted subscription and technology-based solutions coupled with deep domain expertise.  We now have more than 8,500 colleagues in over 40 countries worldwide, and we work with over 200 partners to deliver value and success for our customers. Today, Clarivate is a publicly traded company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker NYSE:CLVT.  Clarivate is committed to building, nurturing, and developing a diverse culture of belonging where new colleagues can bring their authentic self to work every day! Join us!  Role Summary  As a subject matter expert to sales and pursuit activities, you will act in of support Account Managers focusing on all new sales for the products and solutions of Clarivate to the Academic and Government sectors.The role works in close partnership with internal stakeholders to proactively drive gross sales and revenue.  Role Responsibilities:  You will be responsible for the following:  Identify sales opportunities with account managers and leading customer conversations, product demo, professional service related discussion and explanations Identify agenda of research excellence in world-class and frame it with Clarivate offerings to design custom-specific solutions. Develop relationships with customers to ensure Clarivate’s position as a trusted advisor in the agenda. Collaborate with internal stakeholders including sales team as well as regional/global teams. Coordinate scoping, pricing, and proposing for consulting projects while monitoring the progress of work as well as guiding a delivery done by the global team Deliver the presentations at high-level decision makers for Intellectual Property Solutions  Target customers  Government organizations-R&D funding agency/R&D policy makers, Ministry, Universities  Solution offering  IP related database, data analytic service or consulting for technology landscaping, performance evaluation, R&D planning, emerging research/technology identification, etc.  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree or above Strong experience on sales or business development. Good understanding of R&D and technology innovation life cycle Good communication, customer relationship management and presentation skill required. Good understanding of business for government and Academy Strong interpersonal skills Ability to organize and execute a sales plan Become a Product and Workflow Expert in products, solutions and service. Minimum years of experience: 7 years With integrity, passion and good collaboration with internal/external stakeholders. Good business English.  It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Pharmaceuticals, and Information Services

description: In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.  The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.  Want to be a part of our team?  The Sales Administrator will be found in most operational environments where there is enough sales work to justify the services of one or more sales administrators. Depending on the size of client accounts and the amount of work that is delegated to the sales administrator, sales administrators’ numbers will vary.  Generally speaking Sales Administrators can report to Sales Administration Team leaders, Sales Managers and Leaders, more Senior Client Managers or Sales Operations Managers.  The Sales Administrator acts as key support person to the sales teams. They assist members of the sales force by performing all sales order related administration.  Working at NTT  Sales Administration  These staff members contribute to operational sales effectiveness by establishing relationships with vendors and coordinating every day interactions, queries and general information sharing with them.  Sales Administrators are typically assigned to support one or more Client Managers and/or Sales Specialists. Their day to day duties include providing quotes for clients either from direct requests or on behalf of the Sales team. This might involve a degree of product pricing where the Sales Administrator sometimes has the ability to influence the price and margin, by suggesting different products dependant on lead times, promotions, alternative suppliers and programmes. Once the order is raised they will check the quotes to ensure that what has been ordered has been quoted and that the correct terms and conditions have been applied.  They may be required to manage aspects of the purchase order process by generating, distributing and administrating purchase orders. When necessary they will receive goods on behalf of the sales team and deal with the received goods appropriately.  They manage vendor costs in conjunction with commercial colleagues and ensure access to vendor pricing.  When sales orders are received they process and administer the sales orders. They administer general sales related documentation through receiving, labelling, sorting, filing and distributing as is required.  They capture data and maintain systems as is required by the sales process and sales team. They will also use the systems and data to produce reports when necessary.  In general they provide administrative support to the sales force when it is required. Their success is determined by the client service orientation, their team work and management skills and their ability to manage their assigned work processes.  Behavioural Skills  Sales Administrators have a proactive approach, pay attention to detail, have good verbal and written communication skills and have a service oriented aptitude. They demonstrate a positive attitude towards work and can manage assigned job processes. They are able to cope well under pressure and are well organised individuals. They have good interpersonal skills and can interact with a variety of internal and external stakeholders across all levels in the organization.  What will make you a good fit for the role?  Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.  Equal opportunity employer  NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.  R-49102

description: Four-time consecutive winner of the Inc.5000 Fastest Growing Companies award, Accord Group, is looking for the right teammates as we are becoming the number one storm related insurance restoration company in the nation. Our mission is to create remarkable experiences through rebuilding homes and rebuilding lives. When we say lives, that includes our teammates. Our Sales Managers lead high performing sales teams, and have the potential to earn between $150,000 - $200,000 in their first year.  As a trusted and professional leader in our industry, our passion is to give homeowners peace of mind after hailstorms, severe winds and hurricanes strike. 10 years in the industry, our experience working with insurance companies allows us to reliably advocate for our customers as they navigate their insurance restoration. During unprecedented times like these, we have not laid off a single teammate, moreover we are bringing on and developing top talent continuously while en route to our best year yet. Learn More Here - Watch Our Video  Key Responsibilities Build, Lead and Manage – Recruit, coach and develop sales teammates to achieve SMART production goals. Revenue Generation – Lead your team to achieve realistic revenue results. Remarkable Experiences – create a remarkable experience for customers and teammates in everything you do. SKILLS & ABILITIES WE LOVE IN THIS ROLE Highly competitive, supportive and coaching approach to developing teammates Positive attitude working every day with a ‘can do’ approach Thrives in a fast paced, healthy and evolving team environment Gets and gives energy by achieving results through people Ability to create a steady pace for the team staying on pace to goals High integrity and commitment to the team and individuals winning. Skilled listener and communicator using several means to connect with teammates Excellent interpersonal skills, with an intuitive understanding of motivation/influence QUALIFICATIONS 5 years sales and/or sales management experience preferred Referral, cold calling, B to C prospecting and sales skills preferred Proven track record of starting and growing a sales team Intermediate computer skills and ability to utilize our web-based and mobile sales applications Competency in sales CRM preferred Eleven years ago, our founder Dustin Doll, quickly saw that storm restoration is profitable & is a massive market with 96% market availability. When you combine this with a leadership team that has over $1.7B in experience, we expect grow exponentially and are poised to become an industry leader.  Working with our customers we focus on service first, providing free inspections for our both residential and commercial clients. If we believe a claim is warranted, we assist in that process, then work on the customers behalf to get as much damage covered as possible. Our hands on approach to managing the project from start to finish allows for great teammate-to-customer relationships and has contributed to our A+ BBB rating and our great Google reviews. As a company, Accord Group, is responsible for over $325M in restoration projects, and over 22,000 projects completed. We are proud to say that we have are operating completely debt free since 2010. If you’d like to join us on our journey, please apply today.  Integrity … Golden Rule … Discipline … Humility … We Are Accord!  Background, motor vehicle, drug & employment checks will be required.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Job Summary: Execute strategic account and business development plans for OEM and Specialty Bio Distributor (SBD) channels within the Asian biopharmaceutical market, specifically China, Korea, Taiwan, Malaysia, Singapore and Australia, but excluding Japan and India, to achieve accelerated growth objectives. Be a technical resource on single use and point person for our specialty bio distributors and OEM’s. Understanding of the Bioprocess manufacturing process, and how single-use benefits the process. Experience managing fast paced business through multiple channels. Professional self-starter who thrives in working in an autonomous environment. Must have strong time management skills. A solid sales acumen, with the ability to promote “value.” Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a customer centric mentality. Ability to communicate clearly in Chinese and English, both written and orally. Strong project management skills. Solid negotiating skills. Preferred Job Qualifications Demonstrated ability to manage and maintain formal programs for large account management. Experience with multiple channel partners, including distribution, OEM and single use system integrators Previous employment at a single-use supplier or bioprocessing manufacturer who utilized single-use technology. Understanding of GMP and other regulatory requirements. Travel Requirement: Yes, over 60% International and domestic  Physical Demands The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands and fingers and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and/or stoop. The employee must frequently travel by plane and/or car and endure the physical demands that are representative of such travel. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of tasks, responsibilities or duties. CPC reserves the right to amend to meet legal, business and organizational requirements as necessary.  What CPC offers you... Over 35 years of design innovation, with over 20 years servicing the Bioprocessing market. Working in the fastest growing and most exciting business unit within CPC. Ability to be the face of the company and the freedom create your own schedule. The opportunity to make a direct, significant impact in a growing organization with the ability to grow personally and professionally. A comprehensive, competitive salary and full benefits package all while working in a casual, friendly, and fun workplace culture that respects your contributions CPC is the leading provider of quick-disconnect couplings, fittings and connectors for life sciences, specialty industrial, and chemical handling markets. Founded in St. Paul, Minnesota in 1978, CPC has more than 300 employees, sales offices in 10 countries with distribution partners and customers around the globe. Used around the world in a broad range of applications, connection technologies from CPC allow flexible tubing to be quickly and safely, connected and dis-connected, reducing spills and increasing safety.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  The Client Development Sales is a commercial customer-facing role that has overall responsibility for Shenzhen & WPRD local customer development. The purpose of the role is to drive new business growth in Logistics and Solution business, he/she will be expected to build strong and healthy pipeline, and leverage with internal teams to boost sales performance by securing high gross profit business.  Key responsibilities Accountable for acquiring and securing new customers in L&S and other Maersk products through ongoing strong management of a robust sales pipeline. Responsible for target customers’ RFQ preparation and responses, solution design, value propositions, client presentations, gathering Maersk capability information (case studies/references), maintaining information on what we do globally for clients today, and providing input on client requirements with unique solution proposals. Accountable for developing customer relationships with senior decision-makers and introducing them to key Maersk executives through well-planned and coordinated customer events and QBRs or other means. Able to demonstrate quantitatively how Maersk can bring customers’ strategies to life, while detailing specific qualitative competitive advantages of working with Maersk. Accountable for ensuring that customized customer solutions are fully-scoped, with robust pre- and post-sales engagements and commitment from internal pursuit team members, enabling flawless execution of the sold value proposition. All contracts and agreements for each customer solution to be vetted and authorized by all respective signatories from both internal and external parties, in line with Maersk corporate guidelines, policies, procedures and ethics. Accountable for the implementation and compliance of all relevant commercial ‘ways of working’ blueprints and all associated tools, including (where relevant) Account Management plans and Pursuit Plans, to continuously drive results from Existing and New Solutions Customers Encouraged to build and leverage external network to bring increased awareness about Maersk’s global brand and specific capabilities in local markets, with a key focus on our global network and customer support. Accountable for ensuring that IOP/SOP’s / contracts / agreements for all customers within the Solutions portfolio are comprehensively documented, maintained and appropriately communicated to all relevant internal and external parties. We are looking for  l 5+ years of international and domestic logistics and vertical industry sales experience desired.  l Accountable for acquiring and securing new customers in Logistics and Solution through ongoing strong management of a robust sales pipeline.  l Responsible for target customers’ RFQ preparation and responses, solution design, value propositions, client presentations, gathering Maersk capability information (case studies/references), maintaining information on what we do globally for clients today, and providing input on client requirements with unique solution proposals.  l Actively participate in company promotional events, as well as outside company sales gatherings such as networking events and client promotions.  l Be a strategic seller by focusing on multi-level relationships with customers: networking with customers, building strong relationships, obtaining information from various parties to understand internal activities and find selling opportunities  l Interface with various internal departments to insure delivery of customer satisfaction.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Description  Responsible for managing the relationship and business strategies for less complex accounts (regional, single business unit, internal, etc.). May have responsibility for larger, more complex accounts when paired with a more senior account manager. Responsibilities include selling the organization's products to assigned business customers to achieve sales goals, expanding existing customer relationships and executing account sales plans in support of business strategy.  Develops, manages, and maintains business relationships with assigned accounts supporting the organization's sales strategy.  Supports growth or new business opportunities and cost initiatives.  Extends and expands sale of products and services to existing clients.  Leads, manages and coordinates communication and interfaces with the customer at appropriate levels.  Negotiates and implements contracts with accounts as authorized.  Manages production and distribution issues associated with accounts.  Responsible for establishing and maintaining positive customer relations.  Acts as a champion for the voice of the customer within the business.  Supports account strategy and works with key stakeholders in the business to achieve optimum results.  Responsible for measuring customer satisfaction and creating action plans to improve satisfaction based on data.  Manages accounts receivable deliverables including payment terms negotiation discussions.  Drives Customer Focus Six Sigma initiatives to strengthen relationship with customer.  Drives cross business unit account development in support of account strategy.  Skills  Qualification & Experience:  Instills trust - Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.  Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.  Ensures accountability - Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.  Intuitive Listening And Adapting Solutions - Translates needs, expectations, or asks from customers, stakeholders, etc. into actionable solutions through active listening and intuition; chooses or produces solutions (e.g. process change, tool, product, service, etc.) to meet or exceed the customers’ or stakeholders’ needs or expectations or to provide value.  Articulating Value Proposition - Interprets internal and external customer needs based on relevant application; explains and demonstrates products, solutions, and services to distinguish strengths and weaknesses to meet customer's specific needs to differentiate against competition.  Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.  Manages conflict - Handling conflict situations effectively, with a minimum of noise.  Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.  Sales Forecasting - Collects and assesses customer data from internal and external sources; compares against historical data to determine useful inputs and create a forecast of future consumption patterns.  Account Planning - Identifies objectives to drive execution of business and/or account strategy by reviewing the status relative to where it needs to be and enabling tracking of progress against targets.  Channel Awareness - Explains and contextualizes industry structure, dynamics, and path to market in order to advance organizational goals.  Developing Account Strategy - Determines current status of account in terms of relationship, financial, product competitiveness, barriers, quality, and service and defining desired future state by balancing customer requirements and business capabilities in order to define achievable targets aligned with the business strategy.  Sales Pipeline Management - Plans proactively for successful execution of account/territory-level sales strategies and plans based on current pipeline; evaluates pipeline health (size, contents, progress); adjusts sales strategy, plans, or high impact activities accordingly; as applicable coaches sellers in order to achieve sales objectives.  Education, Licenses, Certifications  College, university, or equivalent degree in marketing, sales, technical or a related subject or equivalent industry experience required.  This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.  Experience  Significant level of relevant work experience, including previous customer and/or product experience required. Purchasing/commercial contract negotiation preferred.

jobTitle: 建材销售经理 - 华北
description: Job Purpose and Impact  嘉吉金属供应链（CMSC）在全球贸易，分销和加工原材料和钢铁产品方面与客户积极合作。这些产品包括：铁矿石、钢坯、热轧、冷轧、涂层产品、线材、棒材和型材。它在世界各地的办事处为矿工、工厂、加工商和最终用户提供服务。  钢铁工业正在经历一个颠覆性的变革时期。正是由于钢铁行业的复杂性，大宗商品超级周期的存在，和不断加剧的原材料以及钢铁价格的波动性，给钢铁行业带来挑战的同时也为嘉吉金属在行业变革时期展露身手创造机遇。  嘉吉金属战略着眼于中国战略客户的需求和利益。我们坚信，中国钢铁行业有许多未发掘的价值；我们相信，通过合作并创造量身定制的解决方案，我们可以帮助客户发掘这些价值并获取成功。  基于这些，嘉吉金属致力于推动一个结合其自营交易引擎和客户解决方案销售引擎的战略。这一角色是结合和发展该战略两部分流动性需求的关键角色。其职责包括管理日常实际执行，以确保低运营风险，制定能够带来交易策略所需流动性的营销策略，管理市场信息，以及制定客户解决方案和寻找客户机会  Key Accountabilities  30% 建材（螺纹钢为主）现货业务的采销执行 根据交易计划和策略，独立负责北方市场建材业务的采购和销售 识别并寻找现货市场的流动性，以便销售和购买 随时了解现货交易价格和现货钢材的市场深度行情 了解并有能力控制现货交易的执行风险 根据市场的实际情况提供观点和见解，并为交易策略提供建议 30% 市场信息分享 对实体交易、供应链动态及影响有清晰的认识，对市场方向有较强的把握 与分析和商业/交易团队合作，通过收集来自钢厂/仓库/贸易商/供应商/客户的见解来支持交易策略 30% 风险管理解决方案 根据区域领导和/或实体领导制定的交易战略，为现有/新客户和供应商进行日常风险管理解决方案 寻找新的战略客户和新的业务关系 根据客户的风险管理需求，推荐并销售适当的期现货结合的解决方案 10% 内部协作 与业务范围内的各职能团队（包括供应链、法律、信贷、税务和财务团队）进行良好、快速的协作，保证交易高效执行； 在整个供应链的责任范围内持续/定期审查效率低下的环节并加以改进 为不同类型的交易完成各类系统的规范操作 Qualifications  职位要求 学士学位 至少3年相关建材相关交易/销售经验 能够在高压力、快节奏环境中工作。 良好的沟通技巧和人际交往能力。 对整个供应链的风险有良好的认识，并有降低这些风险的经验。 熟悉钢厂、钢铁客户和市场动态（如风险管理）的市场情报
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: Join Trustana and be a part of our mission to democratize access to import & export markets for all. We are working towards facilitating international participation from companies of all sizes, and supporting the evolution and modernization of SMEs globally.  Trustana is a curated B2B trade platform of verifiable, international traders. Designed to empower buyers and suppliers to grow their businesses with confidence, Trustana connects trusted trade partners and supports them through their end-to-end trade journey.  Trustana's goal is to enable buyers to bring the highest quality products to their customers by connecting them with pre-screened, curated international suppliers. It also helps suppliers to expand their customer base by supporting the internationalization of their products and connecting them with reputable buyers. The platform leverages decentralised technology to enable users to have control and ownership over their data.  Founded by Temasek, a global investment company headquartered in Singapore, Trustana is based in Singapore with a hub in China.  Key Responsibilities Support the end-to-end process of on-boarding new customers, handling incoming customer feedback, issues, and requests working closely with the GTM and technical team Collaborate with GTM team to support existing, new, and potential customers with utilising the Trustana product Follow up on inbound sales leads, understanding customers' needs and identifying collaboration opportunities Educate and train customers to learn new policies, functions, rules and trends Liaise directly with Trustana customers to develop deep understanding of customers' concerns and thoughts regarding the use of products and maintaining strong relationships with key users and decision makers; keeping them connected/updated with product enhancement Act as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas Collaborate and coordinate with GTM, Product and Build team to ensure ongoing customer success Support in developing a data-driven approach to achieve team KPIs Improve customer satisfaction by collaborating with stakeholders to enhance process, productivity, efficiency and customer experience Assume ownership to drive any issues related to customers' account to resolution and troubleshoot as needed Build and maintain a comprehensive database of referenceable customer contacts in CRM  Ideal Candidate Requirements Bachelor's degree in a related field Above 3-4 years B2B experience in an account management and/or customer success role within high-growth, technology companies. Experience in E-Commerce/Marketplace will be highly advantageous Experience tracking sales activities, customer data and customer status Strong passion for working in a start-up environment Experience in working in cross-functional and interdisciplinary teams including Product, Engineering, Business Development and Operations Empathetic, patient and a great listener Customer-centric, enjoy communicate and fostering positive business relationships Ability to multi-task across a high number of accounts at any given time.  Equal Opportunity Statement  Our company embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.  We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

jobTitle: Enterprise Sales Specialist - Guangzhou/ Shenzhen, China
description: Mendix Is a Low-code App Development Platform  First, what is low-code? Low-code is a visual approach to software development that enables you to abstract and automate every step of the application lifecycle. Gartner predicts that “by 2024, low-code application development will be responsible for more than 65% of application development activity.” Mendix is repeatedly ranked a Leader in analyst reports from Gartner and Forrester. In the 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant for Multiexperience Development Platforms, Mendix placed at the very top of the Leaders quadrant.  Mendix, the global leader in enterprise low-code, was created to promote collaboration between Business & IT teams. Thousands of forward-thinking companies around the world like Ford Auto, Rabobank Netherlands, Zurich Insurance, and Red Bull, can unleash their best ideas faster with the help of the Mendix Platform.  Mendix Is a Siemens Business  Siemens is a Top 10 Global Software Company and a leader on Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in the World! With the acquisition of Mendix in 2018, Siemens Digital Industries Software is driving transformation to enhance the digital enterprise where engineering, manufacturing and electronics meet the future of innovation. Mendix employees have the opportunity to work in a hyper-growth environment with the support of Siemens’ unbeatable market position and resources.  We're investing to accelerate our momentum, and we're looking to grow our APJ team. If you constantly strive for excellence, are passionate about innovation, and want to work with a collaborative, energetic team - then Mendix is for you.  As an Enterprise Sales Specialist, you will engage with enterprise customers and prospects across various industry segments. You will offer solutions that fundamentally change the way organizations deliver critical web and mobile business applications while building value for their companies.  Excelling when working at the senior executive levels, you successfully build relationships and establish business value. As an energetic self-starter, you will have the ability to focus on building a solid business pipeline, while addressing problems that impact how your team achieve their financial goals. You will also absorb and analyze feedback from the market, and communicate that back to the product team to help drive the product roadmap.  You’ll Help Our Customers Drive Digital Innovation By Developing opportunities and sales accounts across the given region Identifying and qualifying high value opportunities for Mendix, in conjunction with channels partners including driving sales pipeline with them Building relationships and establishing communications at the highest executive levels in your accounts to understand their needs and priorities, and to speed and simplify the deal process Confirm and communicate the differentiated value of Mendix to the customer at both the technical and business levels Understanding the formal and informal buying process in the customer's environment Identifying the customer approvers, decision makers, and influencers, and develop strategies for each to mitigate risk and increase deal confidence Taking a core role in the closing process including negotiations and procurement activities Consistently communicating and brainstorming with extended team around all aspects of account and opportunity development You’re the innovator we need if you have: Extensive Enterprise Software sales experience (8+ years) and a demonstrated track-record of consistently meeting or exceeding annual quota and performance targets Demonstrated ability to build and manage customer executive relationships at the highest levels Demonstrated ability to manage complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended team Ability to articulate complex ideas and strategies Strong orientation to team communication and collaboration Thorough knowledge of Salesforce to maintain a current and accurate pipeline High Energy and attention to detail Bachelor's Degree or international equivalent What you’ll experience at Mendix: We consider our people as people – not as “assets” We’re focused on results – not on “boxes” and “rules” We’re all unique and we want you to be yourself We celebrate success as a team We care about personal and professional development A journey of a lifetime on our way to the top Working at Mendix  Mendix has been recognized as a Best Cloud Computing Company to Work For by Forbes. With offices in 16+ countries including headquarters in Rotterdam and Boston, Mendix provides an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.  While Each Employee Brings Their Own Unique Cultures And Personalities To The Workplace, We Collectively Live By Our Mendix Blue Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Sales Representative professionally promotes and sells Nutreco products and services to existing and potential customers and establishes and maintains good relations at all levels. The Sales Representative contributes to, implements and realizes the sales/account plan for the assigned account/portfolio, acquires and retains (new / potential) accounts and builds and strengthens customer relations in order to realize Nutreco’s commercial objectives.  Job Description  Sales planning and execution: (Co-develops), executes the sales plan for the assigned product portfolio / area in accordance with the set objectives and targets in order to realize the sales plan and sales targets are achieved Customer Acquisition Approaches and acquires new customers in a proactive manner through various means that may include direct visits, phone, references, etc. within delegated authority (within the sales team), in order to retain and grow the customer base according to expectations and to achieve the sales targets Customer Management Builds trust with new and existing customers by identifying their needs, providing advice and effective solutions to their needs, so that good customer service leads to further improvement of customer satisfaction and customer loyalty levels, and additional revenues and/or profitability Issue Resolution Receives, follows up and resolves or ensures resolution of customer complaints / queries in a timely and efficient manner, in close cooperation with colleagues in Sales and Customer Services, in order to satisfy customer expectations and ensure customer retention. Administration Coordinates, executes, maintains and / or improves various administrative sales processes and systems, in line with the applicable procedures to ensure an efficient and effective sales administration compliant with policies and regulations Management Information Provides insights to management on request, or own initiative, regarding quantitative and qualitative developments within his / her area of sales/expertise, based on reporting guidelines, and ensures all information is appropriately stored and updated, so that management and / or relevant stakeholders are able to make (timely) decisions and determine or adjust sales decisions and strategy. Networking Develops, maintains and expands a network of internal and external stakeholders, representing Nutreco and looks after the interests of the organization, in order to contribute to a positive image of Nutreco, which contributes to the sustainable relationships with stakeholders. Technical / Product Knowledge Builds own product and technical knowledge in relevant product categories. Measures, prepares and quotes customers based on his / her expertise and product knowledge, in order to advise customers appropriately and to conclude the sale of product. Projects May participate in various sales and customer service related projects in his / her area and contributes to project results Our Organisation  Nutreco is a global leader in animal nutrition and fish feed. Our advanced nutritional solutions are at the origin of food for millions of consumers worldwide. Quality, innovation and sustainability are guiding principles, embedded in the Nutreco culture from research and raw material procurement to products and services for agriculture and aquaculture. Experience across 100 years brings Nutreco a rich heritage of knowledge and experience for building its future.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Nutreco is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, military status or any other status protected by applicable local law. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation. Nutreco is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation, including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities.

description: Together, we can beat cancer.  At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions. If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.  Develop technology that turns promising cancer research into leading cancer treatments.  Varian continues to transform the next generation of cancer treatment through our proton therapy solutions. When you join our Proton Therapy team, you’ll work with our state-of-the art ProBeam® system that delivers precise, targeted treatment directly to tumors - potentially sparing the surrounding healthy tissue. Join us in one of the fastest growing businesses in this market, and help us drive adoption at treatment centers around the world.  Responsibilities Include  Varian Proton Solution has been chosen as partner for 5 famous cancer centers in Great China Territory, the growing speed of our customer and market share is leading in the Proton therapy industry. This is a unique opportunity to build and execute a strategic sales plan, leveraging current customer relationships and building/managing a winning. Establishing and managing and relationships with and sells directly to potential customers throughout Greater China territory for Varian’s Particle Therapy business unit. Build up commercial arrangements for PT products together with internal and external partners. Working collaboratively with different functional teams (Sales, legal, tender management, marketing, installation and service) within VPT and Varian’s Oncology business unit from initial customer contact through the tender process, contract signing and conducting. Building productive internal/external working relationships. Reporting directly to GCN Sales Director of Particle Therapy The Successful Candidate Will Possess Experience within the radiation oncology and/or proton market is strongly preferred Extensive medical device/medical technology sales/marketing/BD experience with broad knowledge of the Greater China market. Experience in negotiating with executive level is preferred Collaborative approach to working with internal partners is essential Well-developed written communications and presentations skills required A minimum of 60% travel required A Master degree or above is preferred MUST speak fluent Mandarin and English Varian is required to comply with all local and applicable regulations that may be associated with vaccine requirements for certain roles.  About Us  Together, we can beat cancer.  Imagine a world without fear of cancer. We do, every day. Varian Medical Systems, a Siemens Healthineers Company,  is the world’s leading manufacturer of medical devices and software for treating and managing cancer. For more than 70 years, we have developed, built, and delivered innovative cancer care technologies and solutions for our clinical partners around the globe to help them treat millions of patients each year.  Varian & Siemens Healthineers have united to accelerate our path to further innovation.   Taking an Intelligent Cancer Care approach, we are harnessing advanced technologies like artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data analytics to advance cancer treatment and expand access to care to help patients become survivors.  When you join Varian, combined with Siemens Healthineers, you become part of a global network of innovative and inspired minds working together across the globe. We keep the patient and our clinical partners at the center of our thinking as we power new victories in cancer care. Because for cancer patients everywhere, their fight is our fight.  Varian is required to comply with all local and applicable regulations that may be associated with vaccine requirements for certain roles.  Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.  We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.  #TogetherWeFight  Privacy Statement
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Freudenberg is a global technology group that strengthens its customers and society long-term through forward-looking innovations. description: Overview  This position will directly report to KTA’s China sales Director responsible for solving customer’s technical problem timely accordingly to company’s requirement, conduct promotional test of chemical and generate sales turnover.  此职位将直接向 KTA 的中国销售总监汇报，根据公司的要求，及时解决客户的技术问题，创造销售业绩。  Essential Functions主要职责  Responsibilities Go to customers to present and sell products 积极主动拜访客户，为他们展示和销售产品 Offer solution on problems encountered by customers, provide guidance and comprehensive solutions timely. 解决客户在生产过程中遇到的问题，及时提供技术指导和全面解决方案。 Lead Kemin expansion and sales growth in assigned accounts. Achieving consistent growth in sales and gross margin for assigned accounts, in accordance with annual sales budgets;  主导建明对重要客户的拓展和销售增长。按照年度销售预算，达到预定的销售和毛利增  长。  Managing existing customers and searching new ones（including the direct customers and distributors）; 管理现有客户，寻找新客户(包含直接客户和代理商); Reporting to superior on a regular base with written reports; 定期向上级报告书面报告; Sharing contacts, ideas, and market situations with the commercial team frequently; 经常与销售团队分享客户情况、想法和市场情况 Write the report after vists and use tools required of the company. 撰写报告，并按公司要求上传文件。 Sharing informations about competitors situations and products 积极主动掌握竞争对手的产品和动态。 Managing budget and forecast 管理好目标和预算。 Opening new market Managing a new business segment Other Functions其他活动 Attending industry tradeshows, conferences, and events if required. 视情况需要参加工业贸易展，会议和活动。 Qualifications  MINIMUM EDUCATION (including licenses, certifications, designations, etc.) 最低学历(包括执照、证书、职称等): At least high school with 3/5-year technical service experience in chemical business and/or enzyme for textile;高中以上学历，3年以上酵素或纺织行业相关经验。 Essential Skills & Experiences基本技能和经验 Young and dynamic with capacity in creating team-work with colleagues; 年轻、有活力，有能力与同事建立团队合作关系; Good communication skill with customers; 良好的客户沟通能力; Being resilient to stress and time pressure; 能够适应压力和时间压力; Empathic attitude, need to understand the customer needs 具有同理心，精准的掌握客户的需求。 A high degree of personal motivation, a desire to make an immediate contribution and a distinct sense of urgency. 高度的个人进取心，有立即作出贡献的愿望和明显的紧迫感。 Car owner and total independency into reach clients or meetings location; 有私车，可以独立的拜访客户 Proficiency with computers, including Microsoft Office products and database development programs. 熟练使用计算机，包括Microsoft Office产品和数据库开发程序。 Basic English written and spoken. 基本的英语书写能力。 Location-need base on below area:  Guangdog, Zhejiang, Jiangsu  工作地点在广东，浙江或江苏。需长期驻扎在当地。

description: Metal Work Pneumatic Components(Shanghai) is a subsidiary of Metal Work Spa with HQ in Shanghai, specialised in the production of pneumatic components for automation systems. Now we are looking for Sales Engineers in Wuhan.  Job Description: Develop new customers and maintain the current customers and establish excellent customer relationships Provide general technical support to clients Achieve turnover of own area  Requirements： Chinese citizenship University Degree (mechanical, electrical or electronic) Familiar with industrial automation products, technical experience background is preferred  Familiar with MS Office, CRM, and any other IT business tool Customer service attitude, good interpersonal and problem-solving skills Good communication skills, teamwork, and business trip are required.

该职位来源于猎聘  Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.  We are currently looking for Sales Manager in Lonza Bioscience. You will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.  Key Responsibilities  To achieve sales targets by increasing product sales to existing and potential Pharma and Biotech (and academic) customers.  Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform  Develop tactical action account plans to increase sales to reach budgeted sales objectives  Assess sales potential in order to achieve specific sales targets  should Provide financial information to management by researching and analyzing accounting data; preparing reports. Prepares asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information  Maintain accurate customer data in CRM  Follow up on leads and opportunities on a timely fashion manner  Prepare and submit to management timely and accurate reports that provide information regarding sales and market activity and current status of major accounts  Accurately report financial forecast information for the designated territory on a regular and annual basis  Key Requirements  Rich sales working experience in biopharma, vaccine, cell and gene therapy field. Articulate and well accustomed to a client facing role  Education: Bachelor degree above, major in bioscience related.  Good team player, result-oriented, open mind, and love to face challenge.  Good English in written and oral will be plus  Business travel: 50%  Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.  People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.
